text:
Lokasi villa yang tepat di pantai lovina merupakan nilai plus jika dibandingkan dengan penginapan lainnya. 
Kami sekelurga menginap di kamar dengan kapasitas 5 orang plus sarapan yang termasuk dalam harga kamar.
Villa ini juga akan membantu kita untuk booking perahu jukung yang akan membawa kita "berburu dolphin" di habitat aslinya.
Sayangnya pantai lovina sudah mulai banyak sampah domestik yang mengurangi keindahan pantai ini.
title: Cocok untuk rombongan

owner_response.text: We clean our beach and the neighbours beach every day.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Memilih hotel ini berdasarkan review2 yang ada. 
Hotel ini penuh kejutan. Jalan akses yg rusak seperti jalan pematang sawah,  tanpa lobby hotel yg membuat kita bingung memanggil mencari petugas, kolam renang yg lebih kecil dari kolam ikan dirumah. What a surprise... dengan harga yg saya bayarkan.. jelas sangat terlalu mahal.
Bagai mana dengan kamar? Bersiap utk kejutan2... kasur yg jauh dari dibilang nyaman.. bahkan saya yakin akan membuat punggung sakit karena kualitas busa yg sangat jelek, (sehingga saya harus komplain dan meminta ganti kasur), sisi kiri dan kanan tempat tidur utama dibuatkan meja kecil dari beton dengan keramik utk lantai atau dinding, 
toilet tanpa shower kecil.. (sehingga saya perlu meminjam ember dengan gayung). Tidak ada TV apalagi telepon.. 
tempat tidur tingkat yg sdh tua.. dan bila kita duduk duduk ditempat tidur bawah maka kepala kita akan terantuk kasur di atasnya. 
Posisi AC terlalu dekat dengan kasur atas (sehingga saya harus menurunkan kasur di lantai)
Saya merasa kecewa  dengan review2 sebelumnya.. dan sangat menyesal memilih hotel ini. 
Bahkan saya memesankan kamar utk driver dengan harga di bawah 200 rb dilokasi lain yg tidak jauh.. kondisinya lebih baik dari hotel ini.. baik kondisi hotel, sarana maupun kondisi dan sarana di kamar.
Pengalaman terburuk dalam memilih hotel.
title: Mr

owner_response.text: Our family rooms are for 2 adults and two children.  Not for 5 adults that this family required.  The guest was given a brand new mattress from another room but still that was no good.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Letaknya di daerah lovina bali. Masuk ke lokasi dari jalan besar melewati jalan kecil dan sawah. Villa lama tapi sangat terawat dan bersih. Tempatnya tidak begitu besar hanya beberapa kamar tetapi suasananya terasa seperti rumah. Ada kamar buat keluarga dengan satu ranjang besar dan satu ranjang tingkat bisa tinggal berempat. Tidak ada TV di kamar, tersedia pemanas air. Sarapan pagi pemandangan langsung ke pantai. Jika mau lihat lumba lumba tinggal jalan kaki ke pantai paginya untuk naik kapal kecil per orang sekitar 70 ribu rupiah. Sebaiknya punya kendaraan untuk bisa main ke salah satu pantai yang banyak cafe cafe tidak jauh dari villa ini. Pemilik villa orang asing dan tinggal juga di sini. Harganya juga tidak mahal untuk ukuran satu kamar buat berempat dan sudah termasuk makan pagi.
title: Buat keluarga ok banget

text:
Akomodasi yang nyaman, sarapan yang enak, menu makan malam yang enak dengan menu khusus setiap hari dan tuan rumah yang sangat membantu, Gus, yang suka menawarkan untuk mengantar orang-orang. Para keluarga menikmati bersantai di tepi kolam dan lounge luar ruang sambil memandang ke arah pantai. Singkatnya, tempat yang bagus untuk menginap dengan harga yang terjangkau. Jalan ke arahnya melewati persawahan yang menarik, yang enak dilihat. Matahari terbenamnya indah.

Lovina bukan merupakan tempat yang sangat menarik untuk dikunjungi, kecuali Anda tidak merencanakan akan melakukan banyak kegiatan.
title: Aspek yang bagus di atas laut

text: Ini kunjungan pertama saya ke Bali. Kami hanya menginap di sini 1 malam, tapi jika kami kembali ke pantai Lovina, kami pasti akan memesan kamar di Villa Agung Beach Inn lagi. Sangat bagus untuk bersantai setelah perjalanan panjang di Bali (jalan yang kecil). Lokasi yang indah, layanan yang baik, dan makanan yang sangat lezat di sini. Ya, saya ingin kembali lagi.
title: Hotel yang bagus, lokasi yang bagus, makanan yang luar biasa!!

text: Setelah 8 tahun meninggalkan Bali, saya kembali tahun ini. Dan saya sedikit kecewa: begitu ramai, mahal, kotor dan hotel dengan layanan rendah namun Vila Agung, dengan beruntungnya, adalah pengecualian. Saya telah menginap disana saat perjalanan sebelumnya ke Bali dan saya sudah memutuskan untuk kembali ke sana untuk menenangkan diri di lingkungan yang bersahabat. Saya tidak kecewa. Sangat direkomendasikan (walau anda mencari tempat yang berisik, makan barat dan disko yang murah...)
title: Bali berada pada masa terbaiknya

text: We had a wonderful stay, the owners of the hotel are such friendly people.   The staff are so happy and helpful serving the most wonderful breakfasts.  We really enjoyed out stay, walking out of our room in the morning within a few steps in the wonderful sea snorkelling.  Room very clean .  Was a good base to see sights in the North
title: So relaxing

text:
On arrival, you are immediately impressed what a stunning property this is.
My 19 year old daughter Chelsea has CP cannot walk and uses a Wheelchair.
Villa Agung came highly recommended by one of the Tripadvisor regulars.
As far as accessibility goes there is one small step to our villa and another to the restaurant.
The owners Sandy and Gus are amazing hosts and their wonderful staff so genuine  treating all their  guests with respect and in a kind and caring manner.
Nothing is too much trouble.
The rooms are immaculately clean.
The bed are so comfy with lots of pilliows, which I love.
We had the Villa Studio Apartment,
A queen, a single and a set of bunks, with a good size fridge.

The restaurant foods, are equal to any high end European restaurant, the menu quite comprehensive and good value.
Their breads, jams, sauces, stocks, pasta are all hand made and you can really taste the difference.
The included breakfast is fantastic but if you require extras they available for only a couple of dollars more.

On arrival Chelsea was invited to visit the local village, and Gus kindly transported us each day.
All our activities were organised through here, at very reasonable prices
Dolphin Watching 100 000 pp
Fishing 300 000 pp
Massage 100 000 pp

Laundry was done within the day very cheaply.

The view from the top floor, as good as you can get.

Everything was perfect, We cannot recommend this place too highly.
title: Amazing Stay

text: My husband and I found this gem when we needed to have our visa extended in Singaraja. What a find!!! Directly on the beach, beautiful rooms, wonderful food, clean pool, fabulous staff who will help out with anything they can!  We absolutely loved everything about this place! Gus and Sandy upgraded us to an even more beautiful room at no cost!  The entire rooms and grounds are spotless and it is RIGHT ON THE BEACH!! We loved our time here with this “family” and would highly recommend staying here!! We miss them all already!
title: Fantastic Week at Villa Agung!

owner_response.text:
we always try to help our guests , and it is very rewarding when they appreciate our efforts .
a great couple whose company we would enjoy anytime .
sincerely

Sandy Bauman 
Gus Hochrein
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We arrived on Wednesday for a 2 night stay. Gus Sandy Norman and all the staff were lovely. The rooms were very good size with a balcony. Amazing sea views from pool and restaurant. Our bed a little hard but had worse in Kuta.
Breakfast was very gd. Fresh juice, Best scramble eggs in Bali and baked bread.
Easy to organize a massage and gd price.
Easy access to other amenities and set off main rd so traffic noise no issue.
Arranged dolphin tour through Norman. 
Would come back.
title: Lovina Accommodation

owner_response.text: Thanks for all of that.  We are happy that you loved Villa Agung and please come back soon.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: If you are going to the North of the island, I highly recommend staying in this Villa! My assessment it - 10 and 10!! A lot of advantages: the first line of the ocean, at high tide the water comes to the Villa!)) Very neat and cosy rooms, there is everything in them, rabotaet, cleaned every day! We stayed as a family (husband, me and 2 kids 8 and 14) to relax and not bother each other, we rented 2 rooms - for us and for the kids. But the Villa has many different accommodation options, including rooms for families with 3 and 4 children!!) Very pleased with the clean and tidy pool, which is very well cleaned every morning! Well-groomed and comfortable area of the Villa: swimming pool, sunbeds, comfortable and not wet pads, benches, large balcony on the second floor, bar on the territory of the restaurant overlooking the ocean, where every day see off the sunset cute owners of the Villa)) Staff - very friendly, friendly and caring!! All of us, including children were very comfortable)) On the territory of the Villa live a few dogs that may not seem friendly.. But they are very kind, just do not touch them. When they get used to you, they will fit)) They guarded us the entire vacation, one dog always slept at the door children, while the other guarded the bottom)) the restaurant - thanks to all who prepared food! everything is very tasty, the only thing is expensive))) the Owners are very kind and sympathetic people, especially Gas!! Many thanks to him! His daily smiles and jokes are very uplifting! Special thanks to him for helping in visa extension! He personally took us with the children to the emigration service and helped with the documents!! Yes, we stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks and decided to stay for another two!! And honestly, we do not regret it for a minute! I live here, every day I admire everything that is around and I do not understand why people do not go to the North? There is great weather, gorgeous ocean, incredible snorkeling, diving, dolphins swim every morning, mountains, waterfalls, temples! Everything is great!! I even mastered the bike, because the movement here is much quieter than for example in the South of the island! And Yes, the staff helps not only in the Villa, but also for all other issues, such as daily snorkeling, taxis, trips, bikes)) you can contact us for any questions! Everyone who has not been to the North, be sure to go!! You will not regret! and it's not cold at all, as some frighten on the Internet. The whole holiday was +30, no cloudy day, the ocean is calm and beautiful))))) And if you come to the North, go to Mr. GAZ in Villa Agung!!))
title: Great Villa! Recommend!

photos.caption: Водопад Секумпул))) В 40 минутах езды от Виллы

text: They have spent a lot of money improving their resort larger pool great food and extremely good staff and management...all new pool furniture and two new bungalows. Right on the water front and good bar service. Very family friendly.
title: A great improvement

text:
I visited this hotel based on good reviews and felt very confused when I got there because it’s not a place I would recommend.  Though price is low, I don’t think it’s a good value for price. 

PROS: it’s on the beach, bed is comfortable with feather pillows and owner was very nice

CONS: beach is not nice for swimming - looks dirty and sand not made for walking, very isolated location but amenities/food at hotel not good enough to stay isolated on hotel premises, food is very very bland (I tried six different dishes, and staff often appeared bored and unpleasant (for instance, in the corner chatting and reluctantly doing work).  For me, deal breaker was food, it was pretty bad, cooked by someone who probably don’t care to make it delicious. Finally, room and property might have been nice at one point but it is now old and rusted.
title: Rave reviews might be outdated

owner_response.text:
Villa Agung has been updated many times and the only rust she saw was the sea barrier we erected against the high waves.
This guest stayed one night, ate all of 6 meals and then complained because she couldn't get a warung (local stall) to deliver to the hotel!  The beach is cleaned every day and local restaurants are about 50m away.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
A friend recommended Villa Agung to me a few years ago and within a day or two of enjoying the peace and tranquility, I knew I’d found my happy place. Since then, I’ve returned for a three week stay every six months.

The hotel is on the seafront and it's the perfect place to enjoy the amazing sunsets, sea breezes or watching the fishing boats 

I'm not a fan of large impersonal hotels, preferring the more intimate feel that small hotel’s offer. Being a small hotel, Villa Agung has nine nicely presented rooms, comfortable beds and also family rooms. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly.

The ocean side restaurant is lovely and on the floor above is a perfect place to read or simply relax or gaze at the water.  I’ve eaten most of my meals at Villa Agung and found the food delicious and freshly cooked, plus they make their own pasta and bake their own bread.

I can highly recommend Villa Agung
title: Villa Agung is my happy place

owner_response.text:
Thanks for all the good words and recommendations.  
We love having you with us and all your great ideas.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: If you are looking for a Marriott City Centre Villa Agung isn’t that. Instead,if you like a beautiful and relaxing waterfront villa-like small hotel then don’t miss out on this place. The staff is fantastic. The food is great!!! The pool is delightful. And the prices are very very reasonable. No TV’s which at first disappointed me but I did not miss it for a minute. Get out of the hustle and bustle of Kuta and Nusa Dua and get out to the country in Lovina. Definitely the best part of my trip to Bali!!!
title: Perfect!!!!

text: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this delightful Beach Inn with our 2 teenage daughters. We found the rooms to be comfortable - grounds and outside areas relaxing and clean. The food at the restaurant was top notch and there was no need to look any further for alternative food choices. The staff could not have been friendlier and our hosts Gus and Sandy treated us like old friends. Of course they are situated right on the beach which makes for a beautiful setting anytime of the day.

owner_response.text: So glad you were happy here and it was a delight to have your lovely family.

text:
This place is heaven,  so nice! The whole place is just paradise. The staff is nice, owners are nice, the pool is great, the view and sunset are the best. 
The staff and owners are happy to arrange dolphinwatching, rides to different sightseeing etc. 
The place is a bit off, but you really don't (and definiately don't want to) leave. 
The food is good at the restaurant,  breakfast is very good.

I am researching all the other good restaurants that I can recommend so you can choose and they will provide transport for you.  We can also arrange for you to his all the new "hotspots" we have around Lovina and it is getting quite exciting and sophisticated.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We wished to stay longer here instead of a night. The whole place just renovated with white painting, new swimming pool and massage hut by the sea. 

As we are the only guests during our stay, we really enjoyed our time at Villa. It will be a good place for private wedding or group stay. Family rooms are available by the pool and 4 standard rooms upstairs. All rooms with ocean view.

The rooms upstairs are connected to the restaurant's 2nd floor which is very convenient for guess. Where you can have your meals by the beach. The only irritating part was the salesperson will try very hard to sell you things when they walk by the villa despite they can't step into the villa.

There is another star gazing deck besides the rooms.
title: Excellent stay!

owner_response.text: We wish you could have stayed longer too!  Thanks for all the kind words.  I built the wall by the beach which has discouraged some vendors but they can still see you.  They also have to contribute to the beach cleaning fund, which has cut down some more.  I unfortunately have no control over the vendors.  I apologise for this.  Hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Stayed at Villa Agung guesthouse 2 nites.. Read some good reviews so thought i would try.. Must say were on the mark.. such a chilled , friendly place.. Had the impression that place was a bit tired looking, but they have obviously been working hard to brighten up the guesthouse.. and have done a great job.. numerous little quirky details and a very fresh look.. Bedrooms , bathrooms and the whole decor really works well..
Such a comfortable ,homely spacious set up.. Massage by the beach on lovely daybeds at sunset a must..
Great food, V frienly staff and a petfect place to unwind..
Value 4 money++.
Highly recommend

owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for saying such great things about Villa Agung.  We have been working since February and I am exhausted - finally all the dreams I had for the hotel have been realised!  Now I am so proud of the hotel!
Hope your business headaches are resolved.
Sandy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I've visited Bali many times and stayed in many hotels, I decided to stay at this hotel because of the many recommendations from friends, I wasn't disappointed.   

Villa Agung has been owned and operated by an American couple for just over 20 years and within a very short time, I felt like I was wrapped in peace and tranquility.  

The hotel is on the seafront and it's the perfect place to enjoy watching the amazing sunsets, fishing boats and enjoying the sea breezes. 

I'm not a fan of large up-market hotels, I much prefer the intimacy of a quiet small hotel.    Villa Agung offers nine bright, beautifully presented comfortable rooms, plus a high level of attention to detail and service which ticks all the boxes for me   

The meals are a good size, delicious and freshly cooked. They make their own bread and pasta, which I thoroughly enjoyed.

I booked the studio for six nights because I wanted the extra space to entertain my Balinese visitors.  I enjoyed my stay so much that I've booked another 10 nights in November this year.
title: The perfect place to unwind and relax

owner_response.text:
We loved having you stay with us and enjoyed hearing about all your successes for the people of Bali.  Also for your enthusiasm over my plans for a Bali dog clinic. 
Your privacy bushes are in place an soon we will have pool ladder especially for you!
It was an inspiration to meet you and I hope to see you in November.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: we had booked five nights here and we were told renovations were being done, but we decided to stay anyway. when we got there the renovations were more invasive than we realised, so we had some lunch there, which was yummy, then gus the owner came down and we explained it was a lot noisier than we expected and we were changing our accommodation. gus really stepped up and made it so easy for us. he took us to our new accommodation, drove us into town to show us where everything was and refused to charge us for lunch. he would have to be to most obliging, nicest person I've met in a long time. I would recommend this place just on the food and  the owner alone. thank you gus.
title: shame we couldn't stay here

owner_response.text: I understand completely.  It was a rough few months around here but all is finished and shiny and new.  Please try to come back some time and we can really show you our hospitality!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We had a wonderful and relaxing time staying in this small and homely beach inn.  The new pool was very refreshing after a dip in the sea 10 metres away. All personnel -owner, manager and staff promptly made us feel right at home and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you Gus and Nyoman for the tour organising and drop offs up the village street. The dolphin tour, mountain tour and snorkelling were great value. Girls service was fantastic. Great value and the nearly finished renovations wIll add value. Warung Bamboo -60 metres along the beach served delicious Balinese food. We'll be back.
title: Beachfront home away from home.

owner_response.text: So glad you enjoyed Villa Agung.  The staff really do a great job.  Renovations almost finished.  Love to see you again.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
If you are looking for 4+ star luxury at a 3 star price, Villa Agung is not for you.  But if a spotlessly clean home-away-from-home, unpretentious hospitality and waves lapping at your doorstep appeals, you've hit the jackpot.

Yes, the resort looks a little bit tired, but the swimming pool is brand new (and beautiful), the beds are comfortable, the shower is hot and the view is breathtaking in its simple beauty.  

Host Gus, Nyoman and staff send the clear message that nothing is too much trouble, and clearly nothing is.  A trip to town with Gus, bikes delivered to the doorstep, pre-dawn coffee and a short escorted walk down the beach for a dolphin tour with the best operator.  Honestly, why stay anywhere else?

Meals are fresh and delicious and available whenever you want them.  I especially loved brekky each day with a fresh fruit boat, banana pancake and homemade bread and jam.  The homemade Pina Colada with fresh fruit was also unbeatable.

Its a couple of kms out of Lovina, but we travelled by motor bike or taxi which was very easy and economical.  There is a great Warung (Warung Bamboo) just down the beach.  Maree made a trip into Singaraga to purchase a duck especially out our request.  We had a feast of Pepes (with freshly caught fish), Batutu and Laklak with the duck, an unbeatable meal for less than Aus$10 a head including drinks.

For me, Villa Agung was a blissful getaway from all the trappings of western life.  I enjoyed every second!
title: Home away from home right on the beach

owner_response.text:
Thank you for being so kind to Villa Agung.  We are doing our best to upgrade as fast as possible.  We have a new big pool and courtyard, 2 new rooms with modern features, an upgraded restaurant and a new driveway and parking lot as soon as the hotel is finished.
Our great hospitality and delicious food has not changed and we are proud of all of our staff.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had a lovely stay at Villa Agung, we decided to stay just 3 nights, which was enough time for us to see the small town of Lovina, do a dolphin tour, as well as a snorkeling tour of Menjangan island. We felt extremely welcomed from the outset, as the owner Gus introduced himself and offered to be of assistance once we got settled. He didn't disappoint and even drove us downtown to show us the sites and helped us book our dolphin and snorkeling tour. The cook in the kitchen is also super kind, and is a great cook (the homeade bread they give you for breakfast is to DIE for!). I was really thankful for the hospitality I received here, and although they were in the middle of renovations, they took care to do the best they could to make sure it didn't disturb the guests. The hotel itself is a bit run down, but I can't say we wanted for anything during our stay, and the hospitality definitely made up for the cosmetic appeal. If you are looking for a large resort with a lot of amenities, this definitely isn't the place for you, but if you like a place with a cozy B&B feel, this is a great option. 

*I also wanted to note that the driver which Gus recommends is awesome, I definitely wouldn't pass up the opportunity for him to take you wherever you need to go! He's a great conversationalist and really takes the time to give you a great experience during your drive.
title: Lovely Stay

owner_response.text: Thanks for your very kind review and please come back as the hotel is all brand new with a large swimming pool and 2 more deluxe rooms next to the ocean.  All rooms have a sea view.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Still my home away from home in Bali. 💜💜. Cleaning the beach is still nearly a full time job for Nyoman. Sometimes he has to clean it twice a day, and I am sure it would be much worse in the Rainy Season, as the sea throws up all the rubbish from Java on the beach. The sea can be quite rough in the rainy season, and definitely the garden plants would be ruined by the salt water. 
I still prefer to be in Bali around May/June, as it is too humid for me in the rainy season. Even in May/June, Nyoman is still busy cleaning the beach. 😁. 
Being only a little boutique hotel, Villa Agung is not like a five star resort which has a full time Receptionist, does not have phones in the room. If things do go wrong like your leaking roof, creaky beds etc, just report them to the owners, who live next door, or any of the staff. They are very happy to help to rectify any problems.
The painting of Villa Agung is a never ending journey(due to the salt air and water), and is usually painted once a year.
The charm of this lovely little place, to me anyway, is that it is small, and is NOT a RESORT. 
Also you can check out the filthy state of the beaches down South around Kuta and Legian at the height of the Rainy seasons. They are 10 times worse than the beach out the front of Villa Agung.
I have been coming to Villa Agung since 2007, and still love it and recommend it to friends and family.
title: Answer to Messy Beach posts.

owner_response.text:
We love you Cheryl and all the good things you do for the Balinese families you help.
We often have to paint twice a year and the trash gets washed down the 2 rivers on either side of the hotel in the rainy season and ends up on our beach.  However we have a good cleaning team now and it is mostly clear.  Come back soon.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is a basic facility in Lovina. It is run by an elderly couple along with local staff. 
Upside is its location, we had our food with ocean in the background. However, due to its closeness to sea, during thunderstorm hotel area is covered in water. I can imagine that life is quiet inconvenient for these people. 

Downside is that rooms does not have phones. Sometimes there is no one at the reception. Rooms are very basic. And bed in our room had sharp edges at places.
First morning i woke up due dogs making noise. We had a long journey from airport to Lovina and had reached late in night. It was quiet troublesome.

Overall a good experience. Go for it if you are looking for a experience without TV, Phone and other distractions.
title: Homely basic accommodation with beach in the background

text: Basic accommodation, as long as you don't want o lounge around all day. Beach dirty and not usable. Hotel needs a good revamp and tidy. It doesn't look like much has changed in a while. Mosquitos around, coils supplied by hotel.
title: Beach view

owner_response.text:
Unfortunately this guest came at the height of the rainy season when the storms were fierce and the angry waves tossed up trash from the villages.  We do clean our  beach every day, sometimes twice a day.  
The restaurant was flooded with sand and the surf kills vegetatiion instantly.  The gardens and steps are eroded and the dirty rain makes everything look drab.
I apologise for all of this but it is beyond my control.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We found this place through excellent reviews and were not disappointed. Sandi, Nyoman and the staff were really helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay and saw something of the area.The restaurant is practically on the beach, the breakfasts were great, especially the pancakes  and home made bread. We enjoyed swimming in the sea, although it was rocky in places. The trip on the boat to see the dolphins was good and the skipper was not aggressive in pursuit of the dolphins, unlike some of the other boats. We spent hours on the upstairs verandah enjoying the breeze and the view.
title: We loved it.

text:
Thanks to other reviewers, we found Agung Beach Inn & loved our stay here for 3 nights. 

Everything I had read was true & more.. From the perfect location on the water's edge, some of the best food I have had in Bali, at the open air restaurant to the wonderful Nyoman and the girls..Unnie, Annie, Bennie & Minnie, I knew as soon as we walked into the open air courtyard with the lovely garden pool and 3 amazing large old frangipani trees, I had found a second home in Nth Bali!

Swimming in the Java sea was a first and loved sitting at the upstairs deck on the whitewashed cane chairs.. I felt I was back in the old colonial days sipping our bintangs in the cool breeze and watching the sun set.

Rooms were clean .. White fluffy towels & clean sheets.. Only hiccup was the odour coming from the bathroom drain but as it had been raining heavily, could understand why.. Typical Bali drainage problem!!

Loved our top floor space with front & back verandah overlooking the pool & courtyard, watching everyone going about their day..

I will be back for a lot longer next year Thank you Sandi & Nyoman and girls.. for a wonderful stay Sue & Stas xx
title: Loved my stay here! Will be back next year : )

photos.caption: Nyoman and his big smile outside The Little Cottage

text: Great place on the beach with very friendly owners and staff, right on the beach 6 with great breakfast and dinner. Big , clean rooms. Very quite. I enjoyed my staying there. close to another cafes and bars
title: Nice place right on the beach

text:
We've had another 9 day stay at the very wonderful Villa Agung. It just wasn't long enough. This hotel has a way of capturing your heart and allowing a sense of peace and happiness to invade. It has a character that is often lacking in other hotels, plus hosts Sandy & Gus, along with Nyoman and the crew of amazing girls make a stay here very special indeed.

As usual, our regular room was well prepared for our arrival, it was very clean, with thick bright white towels and lovely bed linens. The room was very fresh smelling - as the staff regularly open the rooms to allow air to circulate and even unoccupied rooms are serviced daily. The free wifi worked well for the whole time we stayed.

The food....oh yes, the food! It's divine....some of the best you'll find, and the restaurant is so close to the ocean, what a treat to dine in such a special place.

Villa Agung appears to have many regular guests, who, like us, appreciate just how special this hotel is. We were fortune to once again meet great people who we've met there before. We never visit without running into someone we've met there before - and I guess that says it all really.
title: A Slice of Paradise

text:
Stayed in room 1 for 3 nights - very good AC. The owners take care to think of many "extras" - eg. mosquito repellant and burning coils, kettle with tea and coffee in the room, as well as a mini fridge among other things. The showers will accommodate taller guests. 

Staff seem to have a great relationship with the owners - the mutual respect is obvious and results in heightened service. 

The owners were helpful in providing rides into the village or to Lovina beach area. 

The beach is swimmable. 

We arranged a dolphin tour and had great success. Nyomen woke us early for the trip with banana pancakes and coffee. 

The breakfast is enjoyable here - eggs toast, fruit, coffee and assortment of breads with butter and jam. 

The upper deck has great views and captures an excellent breeze. The wifi is slow (by my Canadian standards) but was always working while we were here. 

The rooms and grounds were kept very clean. There are resident dogs that are polite and quiet. 

The hotel is far enough from the main road so that there is zero traffic noise. There is a convenient Indo Market across the main road with ATM.
title: Great beachfront Villa

text: Really enjoyed the serenity of this hotel.   It is set back off the main road but coming from Darwin the short track is your usual driveway at a rural property.      We sat upstairs overlooking the ocean having our drinks then had a foot massage while lying on a roll up mat,       Would have given it 5 stars but the rooms need full length curtains -  as the morning light (and the outside light) woke us up and the fan rattled.     So these things need fixing.   Breakfast was adequate.
title: Lovely quiet place to chill

text: We had a good stay in the Villa. The staff helped us with everything we asked for. They booked our transport or rented a motorbike. Also the view from the restaurant is very nice, it's located directly at the sea and the food is really good. The only problem was the bathroom, which had mold. Therefore it smelled accordingly. We didn't address that because we stayed only for two nights. If someone wants to stay longer, this is definitively something that should be fixed.
title: Ok

text:
We stayed at villa agung for 2 nights with my family and friends. It's located by the beach. It's a small hotel with tiny swimming pool. I love  its restaurant that locates very close to the beach. Above the restaurant there is a deck where you can lay down and enjoy the sunset. If you want to have tour to see the dolphins in early morning, you just wait at the hotel restaurant while having some hot tea until the boat pick you up. For this tour you can ask the friendly staffs to help for reservation. The breakfast is nice, you can make choice pancakes, friedrice or toast bread.
It's an old hotel with old furniture, the beds are constantly making noises when you move around. Although I must admit it's a big space for family of four like us because our children got their own bunkbed to sleep on.  It was hard for us to adjust the shower temprature not to mention small amount  of water that came out. We took the family suite, it's the biggest room with small dining area and my friends said it's the only room with tv. For those kind of facilities, we think that it's overprice. But then maybe because we stayed during the school holiday.
title: Over priced hotel

text: This must have been our 5th stay in Villa Agung. Although quite a number of nice hotels have pop up in Lovina, we would still choose to stay with this charming little inn. It has maybe about 8 rooms and a private beach. Although it's a little far from the town, a short stroll along the beach will bring you to some bar/restaurants and local warungs. The staff have been working there for a long time and they are very competent in responding to your requests. You can always ask Gus or one of the staff to arrange for a car and driver and it would be done in a heartbeat. Our favourite place is the chill out area above the restaurant. Very breezy and it's got a great view of the ocean. Perfect place for reading a book with a cup of coffee. Breakfast is simple but the presentation (watermelon boat and papaya boat) made it unique. We used to come to Lovina for the dolphins, but now we come here to some peace and quiet and enjoy the simple charm of Bali.
title: As charming as ever

text: This hotel was very charming.  It was right on the ocean, so it was very relaxing.  Breakfast was provided every morning and was excellent.  We loved the Balinese coffee.  The hotel had a full service restaurant and the food was very good, so we ate there quite frequently.  Our room was very nice and clean, with air conditioning and a ceiling fan.  The shower was great with lots of hot water.  The staff was exceptional and very knowledgeable.  We went with them into the village with them to learn more of the local culture.  The hotel provided rides into Lovina for a low fee.  You could get on a boat to see the dolphins or go to the reef for snorkeling right at the hotel.  We would stay here again.
title: This was a beautiful little hotel right on the ocean.

photos.caption: This photo was taken from the upper veranda overlooking the ocean at sunset.

text:
we booked 6 rooms at Agung Beach Inn after we read the review that dolphin watching is best spot for pick up and has fair price too. 
we certainly did not regret staying there, the villa is located right on the beach, so we were lucky to be able to enjoy 2 beautiful sunsets from the restaurant. 
The hotel staffs also took good care of us from serving breakfast, dinner, and supper snack. 
We recommend to stay at their studio or any room on the first floor.
The owner pak Gus is a very friendly american who made sure we are well taken care of. 
I wouldnt be surprise if one day the hotel would get a nice facelift and will easily ranked as number 1 villa in lovina
title: felt like our own villa

owner_response.text: It was great having all your family here and I hope the rest of their stay in Bali was as good.  Come back and see us again.  You will always be welcome as everyone was friendly and the kids respectful and a treat.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We just there 5 nights with our two little kids (1 and 4 years old). We've enjoyed the stay very much. It is not the newest hotel, but it has lots of charme. The food and beverages are delicious and quite affordable (beer 35k. You often pay much more in other hotels...). Me and my wife ate only vegeterian Indonesian food (plenty of choices) and our daughters ate often fresh made pasta (good job). You eat just beside sea. We've never ate closer to the sea and beach during our seven-month-trip; and the first time an owner offered us a beer! You cannot hope for a better host. Yes, the beach is not the nicest, but this is the north coast of Bali... Anyway, thank you a alot for our pleasant stay!
title: Thank you Gus!

text: The hotel is right on the Lovina beach. we stayed in the studio room which is the only room of its type and separate from other types. Rest all of the rooms, seemingly of the same category/ type, were built like in an apartment. The villa itself is spread in a small or limited area. Studio room was quite big with a small dining table, refrigerator, a small library next to your bed, LCD and other facilities. Four adults can comfortable sleep in this room. Breakfast menu was very good, they even customized it to suit our needs as we are pure vegetarian. The staff was really wonderful, smiling and welcoming, very helpful. Strong wi-fi connectivity which you can even enjoy at the beach in front. Choose this place if you want to go for an early morning Dolphin tour, the boat will come to pick you right at the beach in front of your hotel or just next to it, the staff can help you book the tour which starts at 6 in the morning, prices around 80,000 - 100,000 Rupiah (IDR) depending on your bargaining skills and season, even you can just wake up and enjoy the sun rise here with beautiful blue sky. They have a common swimming pool right in the middle of the villa. The common dining area is located at a very beautiful location, just facing the sea, having two floors, in the ground floor they serve the food and above you can just go an relax on the chairs meditating on the sea :-) or you can spend good time sitting on the beach itself, beach is not really good for swimming but with black sand it looks different.
title: Right on the Lovina beach, best for Dolphin tour planners and early risers to enjoy the sunrise!

photos.caption: Early morning view around the beach.

text:
We have had many stays at the lovely Villa Agung. Our most recent was in May 2016, for 9 nights. The hotel, as has been mentioned in other reviews, is a few years old, but is kept in excellent condition by caring owners. Our room had a few updates since our previous trip (in October 2015), with a new bathroom sink and some new tiling and painting, while the bedroom area boasted a new tiled floor and tiled bedside tables as well as smart new curtains. All improvements are done in keeping with the character of this lovely hotel. Outside, the courtyard and pool are welcoming and overlooked by the three massive frangipani trees while the pool furniture is sparkling white.

As is usual for us, all meals were eaten at the water front restaurant. A filling breakfast is included in the room rate, and includes a basket of home made breads and jams. The menu offers a wide range of meals at a very reasonable tax inclusive price. All meals are well prepared and very attractively presented by the hotels long time staff.The meals at Villa Agung are generally some of the best we eat during our extended holidays in Bali.

Hosts Gus & Sandy always make every guest feel like one of the family. Nothing is a bother, and every effort is made to ensure that guests enjoy their stay. We genuinely enjoy the time we spend together and appreciate the warm welcome that we always receive.

I would recommend Villa Agung to those people who want to stay in a hotel which has personality, and is not just a concrete box. Where you can relax and enjoy the wonderful outlook and know that you are experiencing true hospitality. The wonderful sunsets are a real bonus.
title: Another wonderful stay at Villa Agung

text:
My friend and I stayed at this very quaint hotel just recently; it has a fabulous beach side location!
The hotel in general is a it dated and in need of some refurbishment but it was clean and comfortable with a hearty breakfast on offer everyday! 
We had fantastic early morning  trip to see the Dolphins; this was organise by Nyorman the right hand man of the owner Sandi!
The staff were delightful and nothing was too much trouble!
title: Fabulous location

text:
Me and two of my girlfriends stayed here and we had an excellent time! This places is quiet and located right on the beach where you are going to have beautiful sunset dinners and fall asleep to the gentle lapping waves of the ocean. The food is very good and reasonably priced and you can also get a nice bottle of wine (also reasonable) to sip while you soak in the sunset. 

Gus and Sandy are there to answer any questions you may have and help in any way to ensure your stay is excellent! Gus helped us coordinate rides into town whenever we needed and made some good recommendations on activities. At the same time there was no pressure and you had the feeling he was merely presenting options if you wanted to take them (unlike some places in Indonesia where you really feel like your are being sold on excursions). They are just as happy if you are hanging out at the pool or in the ocean as they are if you are going out to explore Lovina. Gus really just wanted to make sure we had a nice time, whatever that meant for our experience.

My girlfriends also had massages right on the upper deck at the hotel. It was so cheap we did it two days in a row. Where else in the world can you get a massage while you're right on the ocean without having to fork over some serious dollars? If I remember correctly we spent about $12 USD (including tip) for an hour massage. It was fantastic!

Me and my girlfriends had a great time here. The accommodations are simple and clean with everything you need for your stay. 

The staff is just amazing with a warm and welcoming presence, they are great ambassadors for Lovina and for Bali as a whole.
title: Great hosts, beautiful beach, good food!

text: First time back to Lovina in 30 years. Changed a bit. Surprising number of beach sellers who didnt understand "no thankyou". Arranged transport from Tuban. Great driver. Agung was well situated, right on the beach. We got an upgrade to a Villa. Big, very comfortable, spotless. Great hosts. Staff were excellent. Couldnt do enough. Restaurant was very good, very reasonably priced, and what a setting. Brilliant sunsets, and the Bintang was cold.
title: Great spot.

owner_response.text:
Beach sellers are always a problem.  They must not disturb our guests when eating but if I am not in view they sneak a look in.  Unfortunately the beach does not belong to the hotel and the sellers like our beach because it is CLEAN!  If you talk to them, they are mostly nice people just trying to put rice on the table!

Thanks for the nice comments you gave us.  The staff really do try to be the best.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Friendly hosts, right on the beach and wonderful views. 

A little remote, so we hired a bike and this was sorted by the owner. Be careful as the rules of the road are, there are no rules. 

The rooms are big, but a little old feeling. If you want 5 * then don't come here, if you want relaxed, well priced,beautiful views and good hosts then give this place ago
title: Pluses and minuses

text:
Small hotel run in a big size property. You can eat facing the beach either on ground level or the 1st Level.
We have a big family with us and 3 kids....we got a big size room with a bunk bed. The kids were thrilled.

Owners who are expats welcomed us and gave us tips on what we can do. They were nice enough to drive us to the nearest weaving factory for a tour,showed us the spa, gave us time to shop for half hour while they finished their errands, showed us the harbor and the money changer, and the spa (which gave us a pick up and drop facility at no extra cost)
They were so very kind and generous with their time.
Staff can speak English including the security guard which helps. 
 
Food is excellent...we had spinach rivaoli and fish along with mee goreng and fried rice and eggs. 
Staff serves with you a smile and excellent English speaking skills.

We checked in at about 7.30pm and they arranged a dolphin tour for us at 6am which leaves from the beach. 

We even tried to stay back and enjoy the hospitality offered to us but unfortunately we were booked ahead and could not cancel.

Look forward to their big book of dos and don'ts in Lovina/Singaraja kept in every room.
title: Opens to the beach. Lovely hosts

owner_response.text: It was a pleasure to help this family look around our area and they were open to lots of ideas but only had the 2 days.  We hope to see you again sometime.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This villa is old but well maintained. There are only a few rooms, The toilet is big. The rooms are spacious. Aircon and fan work fine. Small pool. Beachfront. Food is okay only. Nothing fantastic. There is a padi field at the front of the hotel. Good for dolphin watching as the bots are very near. Very laid back atmosphere. For the price we paid it was worth the money. Staff are friendly. Overall a good stay here.
title: Villa Agung and its charm

owner_response.text:
Villa Agung was built in 1980 so we are a bit older than most but the property is well maintained even with the damage done by the ocean as we are right on the beach.  It is a constant challenge.  
We have a unique charm and many people express the welcome ambiance they feel when staying here.  We have little glitz and glamour but we have good food and great hospitality.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The room is clean and large except that the aircon is badly located. It only cooled the entrance of the room rather the entire room. Good thing the was a ceiling fan that help cool the room.

The water pressure of the shower is low which make showing a hassle
title: Room/Bathroom

owner_response.text: So sorry you had trouble with the air conditioning.  They have all been cleaned and serviced since then.  If you had told us of these problems when you were here we would have dealt with them immediately.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This was our second visit to Villa Agung. It was even better than the first time because it felt like coming home! 
It is a lovely quiet, relaxing place with a real family feel to it. Gus and Sandy welcomed us like friends and the staff are just wonderful . 
It is very easy going, the staff were so happy to help and really went out of their way to quietly make our stay perfect in many ways. They arranged transport from the airport and when we arrived quite late Gus had a meal ready for us so we didn't have to go out. One example of the kindness of the staff was, on knowing i can't eat gluten, Gus and Sandy tried to obtain some gluten free bread from the bakeries. When that didn't work Ani, Ilu and Komang in the kitchen decided to try and make some. They bought rice flour and experimented with bread, a beautiful banana loaf , yummy pancakes and vegetable balls. They understand the needs of celiac people and I felt confident that they were aware of my dietary requirements. We ate most of our meals in the restaurant and loved them. Ani taught me how to make some of our favourite dishes.
Such kindness really made us feel like we were part of the family of Villa Agung!!

This was a relaxing holiday for us. As we had been before we didn't want sightseeing or adventures we simply wanted to a holiday and relax, read, play guitar, wander around the village and do very little in a beautiful place. It was exactly what we wanted.

The rooms are comfortable. The balcony overlooking the sea is lovely. The building itself has such character. But it is the the people who make Villa Agung special from the hosts who include you in their day with just the right balance of friendliness, to the wonderful team of girls and Nyoman who is always there with his big smile. 

We can't praise it enough!!
We will be back again.
title: A Special Place to Relax

owner_response.text: It was so great seeing these guests again.  They just go with the flow and fit into our style of hospitality at Villa Agung.  They tagged along to places they wanted to see, so it was fun for us too...and the guitar was very welcome too!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Perfect location for Dolphin watching.
Absolutely thrilled to hv breakfast almost next to sea.
Decent rooms.
nice balcony.
Good breakfast
con:
We reached around 8:30 pm and there were no lights as the owner was dealing with havoc due to heavy rain.
it was a dampener. but, we had lights in our room.
Owner did not help much for site seeing etc. was kind of aloof.
title: Damn good location on beach

text:
Although located away from the main "tourist drag", I thought the location was perfect. Easy to grab a bemo out the front to head left to the tourist drag, or right to Singaraja. Gus was a brilliant host, and was able to drop us at both locations, plus others. He and Sandy have lots of local knowledge and readily share. We ate at the restaurant every evening-I was most impressed with the many vegetarian choices. Loved looking out over the ocean and the beach which is regularly cleaned. 
A few negatives: the bathroom drain smelled pretty bad, but the note on the back of the door advises of this because of the location. Keeping the bathroom door closed helped. I also felt cleaning the room wasn't up to scratch. Towels were often not replaced (but no trouble to ask for others which were readily supplied). The bathroom basin and shower recess could have done with a bit better cleaning because of the humidity, resulting in mould. One coffee cup for 2 guests, glasses not automatically replaced. Again, no problem when requested, but such things should be automatic in my opinion. The pool was refreshing, beer and cool drinks usually cold, staff friendly, well priced. I would definitely choose to stay here again.
title: No-Breaking-The-Bank Value Package-for Hospitality, Views, Food & Cost

photos.caption: Early morning sunrise near Villa Agung
Track into Villa Agung past a rive paddy (sawah)

text:
Gus and Sandy made our stay at Villa Agung a special experience. 
They gave us advice on local activities even going as far as driving us in to town a couple of times.
The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the AC worked well, the shower was great. Everything worked well and was provided. Food was yummy and fresh.
Highly recommended. Definitely would like to come back.
title: We had a great stay at the Villa Agung!

text:
It is near the beach and the breakfast is nice especially the pancake. Dinner items are alright. The sitting area above the dinning area has a nice view of the sea. The garden and pool well maintained.
Access road to hotel is narrow and unpaved and is next to a padi field. The toilet lighting is not sufficient and toilet bowl is low. Room is basic and simple.
title: Nice basic accomodation near the beach

text:
I've lost count of how many times we've stayed at Villa Agung, with our most recent stay for 9 nights in October. But one thing that I do know, we'll stay there many more times in the future. lesley n, in the review below this, has summed up exactly why this is a hotel to re-visit time and time again and I completely agree with the comments made. Just one more from me. The walk from the little car park and the turn into the cool breezeway entrance to the hotel courtyard always fills me with a sense of arriving "home". The hotel and pool, as well as the ocean backdrop is just so very beautiful.

Thank you Sandy, Gus, Nyoman and all the wonderful girls, for looking after us so very well, as you always do. We are looking forward to our next visit.
title: Another stay at this wonderful hotel

text:
My travelling companion wanted to see a volcano...I though 'ehhhh' but i am SO glad I went; otherwise I would have missed one of the most deeply relaxing, aesthetically pleasing, gastronomically fulfilling experiences I've had in many years
- and even though i have mixed feelings about BalI - the Villa Agung would be worth coming back for.

Villa Agung Beach Inn is near Lovina Beach and the 'village' of Singarajah
there is a smaller local village close by

The 'official' photographs don't hide anything  but they also do small justice to the ambience, riotous colour and remarkable sense of peace you feel here. We only stayed one night and we were very very sad about that! If we ever came back to Bali - it'd be straight to here for a week at least.

The room is fundamental,light and clean We were in Rm 6 overlooking the pool facing the beach. There are only about 7 rooms and a very nice cottage for families 
The back of the Hotel faces a rice paddy and the road to the village. Mountains can be seen in the background. If we had stayed longer we would have only used the room for sleeping and spent all of our time outside, in and around the very pretty pool,the scattering of chaise lounges, the traditional Balinese raised and curtained platform in the courtyard, the tables on the terrace, 
the restaurant, but most of all the colonial lounge chairs on the upper veradah overlooking the Sea of Java only 20m away. My friend was SO bewitched by the warm sea breezes sound of the ocean and scent of tropical flowers that he declared he would sleep there!

The Hotel itself is completely genuine...like the owner/managers Sandy and Gus.No beige furniture, naugahyde bed heads or flashy features and facilities - if you want those go somewhere else - there's lots around; but there's  only ONE Villa Agung; it has what most places lack these days; soul. 

It was like stepping onto the set of an old Hollywood movie -  white stone balustrades, balconies, and flower pots ; colored riots of tropical flowers and plants, a background of blue water and amazing sunsets with fishing boat silhouettes

We got a really good  deal with the Agoda booking thing ($25 each a night breakfast included) 

Ahhh the food. Don't bother going anywhere else: dine metres from the sea - with white table cloths, candlelight, flowers and an extensive menu Sandy has built up over the years with  authentic Indonesian and excellent Western food. Almost everything is made in the kitchen and the staff shop everyday for the freshest produce.

When we were there the dishes ranged from $3 and $5 to $9 for a fancy seared tuna. 

As for the complimentary breakfast, it was pretty impressive! Forget cornflakes and UHT milk with a piece of white toast and some ghastly spread. The Agung serves a 4 course gourmet choice of fresh and baked goodies
Sandy and Gus dine there too
and Sandy recommended fresh watermelon with toasted coconut & tamarillo sauce to start. 

The rooms have the most comprehensive guest information book i've ever seen - with an informed and caring insider's view of the region that is historical, social, cultural, and personal. 

if you want an authentic Balinese village experience Sandy cares for some of her dogs in the village and you can go along at feeding time if you want - some of her  guests even volunteer at the orphanage down the road; there is an air of social conscience about the owners that I respected

Highly recommended- one for  the bucket list!
Lesley 
I have some fabulous photos if I can just work out how to upload them
title: Wow!

owner_response.text: A review like this, that captures the essence of Villa Agung Beach Inn and what we hope to achieve for all our guests,  makes my heart sing!  I am really grateful that you felt that "special something" that is definitely here at Villa Agung,  thanks to all my staff and guests like you.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I booked this hotel for our family based on recommendations by TA members. I was unsure how we would go, but I really needn't have worried! This is a lovely small hotel right on the beach, with the owners fully involved with the day to day running a care of the guests. They have also trained their staff to be just as hospitable and Nyoman, in particular along with Gus, couldn't do enough for us. From ferrying one of my daughters to and from Yoga each day, organising dolphin trips, drivers, and even having coffee ready for me when I came out to sit by the beach early in the morning. Our baby granddaughter was with us, and Nyoman would organise some yoghurt for her before breakfast time so she didn't get too cranky.
The hotel has a lovely layout, the highlight being that its right on the beach. The verandah above the restaurant was a great place to go and relax, get a massage and watch the sun set.
We only ate in the restaurant the first night, as there were too many places to explore, but breakfast each morning was consistently good, with either fruit platter or juice, followed by a choice of hot breakfast accompanied by a variety of breads & jam.
The rooms were comfortable and all you needed. The Aircon worked well, and while there was a tv - we never used it!!
The hotel is located 1/2 way between Lovina & Singaraja, and well off the main road so you only have the sound of the ocean to worry about. 
We were so comfortable staying there, swimming in the pool, which is cleaned every day, that we struggled to do all that we wanted to do. 
Because of the hospitality you were made to feel like close friends, and it set up an easy atmosphere with other guests, as we made new friends too.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Villa Agung, and would love to come back soon.
title: Wonderful Hospitality

text: Stayed here for 4 nights and had a brilliant time. Location is wonderful, you have breakfast right in front of the beach and its such a lovely view. Gus was very friendly and a fantastic host. Nyoman was also incredibly helpful as were all the staff. We visited with my 8mth old and they were very accommodating of her. The accommodation was clean and the rooms were large. Water pressure was fairly low in the bathroom but that's pretty standard for all of Lovina by the sounds of it. It was definitely worth the drive up if you want a spot where you just want to chill out. The pool was nice and the restaurant food was lovely.
title: Right on the beach and super relaxing

text:
I stayed here in August 2013 (TripAdvisor, why won't you let me choose dates back further than 2014, yet you require a date?!?) - my friend and I decided that if we were going to go to Bali, we wanted to see the whole island, not just the very touristy southern part. 

Villa Agung was lovely - accommodations were simple, nothing super luxury or fancy, but it sits literally on the beach, so that worked well for us! They have a pool and a restaurant, and the owners are very accommodating. You can also walk up and down the beach to get to other restaurants and bars for food and entertainment. I would definitely recommend this to someone looking for something affordable and awesome!
title: Affordable and awesome - right on the beach!

photos.caption: They can organize whatever activity you want - we went dolphin watching!

text:
I love Villa Agung.  Great location, great food and great people running it.
Our second stay - not long enough.  I have recommend this place to friends who now share my love of it.

Great sitting/relaxing areas high on top of the ocean nearly.  
Rooms pleasant and all you need.
smaller pool but the ocean at your feet.
Staff were wonderful 
do yourself a favour and visit Villa Agung.
title: Glad to be back

text: We (myself and my husband) stayed here for two nights and wished we could have stayed longer. Located right on the beach enjoying lovely sunsets and very relaxing during the day.  Food was lovely and fresh. Gus and Sandy were very friendly and helpful treating you more like friends than customers. Because of this there was a great atmosphere among all the other guests staying there.  We met a couple who stay there for 1 - 2 months every year.  Was definitely the favorite part of our holiday.
title: Very enjoyable stay

text:
Spent 3 nites here last month and it was just the tonic to switch off and relax for a few days.
We were met by the owner Gus who really does go out of his way show some old fashion hospitality and was always there to offer advice or suggestions for the next days activities.
The rooms were were neat and tidy and cleaned every day featuring a mini bar in the fridge the prices were exactly the same price as the restaurant which I took advantage of.
We had a room upstairs which was comfortable although rooms downstairs have been renovated recently.
The location is set right on the beach and it was a delight to have breakfast , dinner or lunch overlooking the ocean everyday. We ate in the restaurant on our first nite and the food was sensational , there is a small team of ladies here in the kitchen that really know their stuff and we thoroughly enjoyed every meal we had.
There is a fantastic balcony level above the restaurant overlooking the ocean with some very comfy chairs that proved popular amongst guests for afternoon drinks to catch a fantastic sunset.
Villa Agung is located about a kilometre outside the main town of Lovina but there was never a problem getting a lift from Gus himself or the fabulous Nyoman who was always on call to transport you around.
In all a fantastic boutique little hotel backed by some fantastic staff all at a budget price...would stay again !
title: Fantastic Hospitality

text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Villa Agung.  The room was clean, beautifully decorated, spacious, well air-conditioned, with many amenities.  Gus and Sandi were wonderful hosts.  They interacted with all the guests, made us feel at home, and quickly accommodated our needs, including shopping, drivers, and activities such as dolphin watching and snorkeling.  The on-site restaurant serves delicious gourmet Balinese, Italian, and other meals, at a low price and with the best service we received in Bali.  The Villa is located right on a beautiful, clean beach and the upstairs lounge is a great place to read, relax, and enjoy the sunset.  The entire staff was professional, attentive, and very friendly.  What a fun, friendly, and perfect place.
title: Charming Villa

text:
I've lived in Bali for 16 years and been in and out of almost every crack and crevasse on the island.  This place is my new "go to" spot for rest and relaxation in Lovina. 

Simply put,  it's a peaceful and perfect place to relax and recharge.  

Clean comfortable rooms.  Comfy beds,  with real linen.  Food in the restaurant was nice.  Staff super friendly.  Owners super nice and accomodating. 

The balcony over looking the sea was a great place to pass the time and dream the day away. 

I see other reviewers complain about the beach being rocky and black,  ridiculous complaint to leave on this hotel's review.  They should have learned more about where they were coming before getting here.  

As for the other bad review about sewage smell…  don't buy it….  This place has no fowl smells or flies.  

No,  its not a 5 star hilton,  but anyone expecting such lavishness doesn't understand the charm of lovina and the essence of this part of bali,  not to mention the idea of value for money,  which this place far surpasses.  

Well worth the visit and a few days stay.
title: Perfect

text: We planned to visit Agung villa based on review and mindblowing locationand it was worth every penny.It's just on the famous black sandy beach of Lovina and nothing but the vast Java sea was in front.The sunset was picture perfect and the night was passed with the song of the sea. The owner Gus, is really hospitable, had wonderful chat and he helped us a lot for tours and on our return trip to south bali. We took the dolphin tour at the morning and the sight of diving dolphins in the dept of deep blue sea, has made the lovina tour really special.
title: wonderil location, A must stay in Bali

text: Villa Agung just gets better every year! Lots of new improvements to the hotel, and the Menu still has cheap beautiful food available. Gus and Sandy are still the great hosts they have always been. We had the chance this year to go with Gus and Sandy to two Cremation Celebrations, and a Tooth Filing Ceremony which is like a coming of age ceremony for young people in the village.
title: It just gets better and better!

photos.caption: Like a Local for Cremation Ceremony
Like a Local for Cremation Ceremony

text:
I can't believe I didn't write this review yet.  I am glad I was checking around and saw I forgot.  Sandy & Gus - thank you.  We had such a great time as it seems did everyone else that has visited your hotel.  That in itself ensures me that I choose the right place to stay when we visited Lovina.  You have a beautiful place and are so very lucky to be able to call it 'home'.  Thank you for treating us as a friend and showing us everyday life.  That is why we travel - to learn of the culture and ways of life of people on the opposite side of the world.  

You should be very proud of your hotel.  The staff - girls and fellows -  are amazing but can only be that way with good leadership by their employers and I saw it there.

Your food you serve was as good as or better then any other place in Bali we have stayed.  Usually at hotels we choose to go out for meals but that was not the case at Villa Agung.  With the variety and the price there was no reason to go anywhere else although it would have been very easy to do so. 

Our room was very good.  We had problems with the airconditioner and immediately you moved us to another room without any hesitation.  

I hope the dogs (& Gus) are doing fine.  

By the sounds of it I should be booking our room for when we come back in 2016, you may be booked up with all the people returning.  Have a great year and we will see you again someday soon.
title: Thanks for a great time Sandy & Gus and sharing your piece of paradise with us.

photos.caption: Hello girls - thanks for the wonderful food and great care
What is there not to be happy about you are in paradise
Fabulous food and a good variety of food
The colors of the sea after the storm
Right on the edge of the sea
Relaxing to the sounds of the sea

text:
We have just spent another week at the lovely Villa Agung. No trip to Bali would be complete without a stay at a place we've come to love so much. As always, our room was very clean and well decorated. Linens and towels were spotless and hot water plentiful and very hot. The in room wifi was fast at all times. We ate all our meals at the hotel restaurant as the food is just so very good. Before we even arrived I had the first 5 evening meals in my mind...all the favourites from past trips were still there to tempt me. Deserts were, as usual, absolutely wonderful. The homemade breads at breakfast are to die for....and with the restaurant just a few feet from the ocean, it's such a pleasurable place to enjoy your meal.

Sandy, Gus, Nyoman, and each of the wonderful girls made us feel cared for and welcome at all times. This little hotel is a really special place that we are looking forward to visiting again very soon.
title: Our special place in north Bali

text:
We stayed here and enjoyed our overnight stay. The breakfast had the most delicious homemade bread and homemade spreads. It was lovely to swim in the sea, although their pool is very small.
The staff are great. We felt lucky to have our own car, as it is quite a distance to other restaurants and shops.
title: Isolated but nice

text: We have been traveling to Bali for 27 hrs and not before have we stayed in a hotel that had all you could wish for,great hosts Gus and Sandy,great food,we did not leave the hotel to eat any else,friendly staff always eager to help,wonderful quiet location,neat and comfortable rooms,competitive rates,all this coupled with the snorkelling straight out the front and the magnificent sunset on our last night made for a memorable stay and we will see you again soon Gus and Sandy!
title: Great hosts excellent location

text: Our family of 5 stayed 6 nights. The hotel is very quiet and relaxing with great ocean  views and a small pool. There is good food at the hotel and in the area. The family villa is large and clean. Sandy, the owner took us around on her daily errands. It's a good location to explore the area from.  The beach is course and not ideal for swimming.
title: Nice peaceful hotel

text:
This was one of our favorite stays while in Bali! Villa Agung is RIGHT on the beach. The rooms face away from the beach (ours did anyway) and were set back away from the beach, but the open-air restaurant is right there. They have an upstairs deck on top of the restaurant that is great during the day to relax and watch the waves while laying on a lounge chair, sipping a Bintang and having lunch brought up from the restaurant. At night, the restaurant is candle-lit, very romantic, and excellent food. 

The hotel manager (I would say owner, but you can't actually own property in Bali) is an American named Gus who came and sat down with us during dinner and shared stories about Bali, which was wonderful! He even offered to setup a dolphin boat tour for us to go on the very next morning. 

Our room was pretty standard, had a patio and a/c, decent shower/bathroom, very quiet and no issues with mosquitos/bugs! Very comfortable. 

If we come back to Bali, we will definitely stay here again!
title: Excellent Location!

text: We have stayed at Villa Agung many times and one of the main reasons is the position right on the water front and the food .Xmas day we took a group of 12 people for lunch . Some had not been there before but have since been back for meals. Sandy and Gus look after all customers very well and all staff are very efficient and polite .a must go to when in northern Bali ( Lovina)
title: Great place to stay and eat

text: We had 6 nights here and had the most relaxing and happy time. We arrived exhausted and by day 2 all the stresses had begun to unwind. The location is beautiful, right on the beach. Many relaxing hours were spent on the balcony watching the sea and the beautiful sunsets. The staff were amazing. Sandy and Gus are great hosts and the staff the best we have encountered. Loved them! Nyoman really looked after us and made us laugh while the girls were sensational. Loved their smiling faces and relaxed approach to life. A tear was shed when we left!! We'll be back!
title: Absolutely loved it!

text: This was the best place to stay during my trip! The hotel is lovely, relaxing and zenn! Its 2 km outside the centre but there are small local buses which get you there in no time for 5000 Rupiah. The owners, an American coupe, are the nicest. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious. The hotel is on the beach, your feet can almost touch the see when you are dining. If you want some you time, read a book and enjoy the day passing by, don't leave without visiting this place! :) Love, Jenny & Evelien
title: Just lovely! Realy relaxing!

photos.caption: chilling and relaxing on the veranda

text: Spent 4 days at Villa Agung, Lovina Beach, Bali and what a treat! The owners Gus (originally from USA) and Sandy (originally from the Channel Islands) were welcoming hosts, full of local knowledge and were happy to sit and chat with the travellers. The local manager, Howard, got the weather forecast just right for our trip our to see the dolphins (pods and pods of them!). The food was amazing! Huge choice (veal, real bacon, 4 types of home made bread, etc). If you want to relax and indulge, head to Villa Agung. The "standard" room was better than a 5 star resort we stayed in in Candidasa! The Villa was amazing and great prices, too. (that includes the food).
title: Spoil youself at Villa Agung

text: Gus and Sandy, the owners are fantastic! We felt very pampered and it was just so relaxing. The restaurant was great and had good variety. Everything was neat and clean. 50 min walk to Lovina. Warning: the car ride from the airport to north Bali is extremely rough and you've got to have a strong stomach. Car sickness WILL occur. Use the Inn's driver, Wyan. He is very trustworthy and won't deviate from the trip to take you on detours, like other drivers do. Just ask Gus and he will organise.
title: Perfect choice!

text:
I read alot and I became enamoured with this Hotel. It didn't disappoint at all... far from it. I loved the journey to Lovina, driving throught the mountainous countryside... A visit to the water temple over the lake made for a lovely break along the way. To be greeted by Sandy, who was a delight to correspond with and a lovely hostess during our stay. The Hotel is intimate and personal and does need some work.  Sandy is in the process of renovating, and while this didn't interfere with our stay at all, the outcome will only add to the charm of the place. 
The staff were lovely and we ate at the restaurant and it was great. 
We loved sitting in the upstairs deck overlooking the beach... a beautiful place to relax. Pool small and intimate just as the hotel is.
Can't wait for a return visit post renovations. 
We Loved, loved, loved our stay
title: Amazing Bali escape.

text:
I can understand why people love this place because it has a lovely peaceful friendly vibe - however the beach didn't do it for us because it is only a tiny bay - you can only walk for about ten minutes before needing to go around boats/rivers/headlands etc, so it's not a place for people who love to walk on the beach. The sand is also black and there is a lot of rubbish, although the owners clean the spot by the hotel. I also prefer the sunbeds out on the sand, maybe because it was low season they were in a line in front of the restaurant, and for shade you had to pull them into the restaurant.

The room was OK, maybe a bit tired - they were refurbishing downstairs - but it was a good size with a designer bathroom, and what I loved about it was it had a large comfy bed with white sheets, loads of pillows, good reading lights and a kettle with white mugs so you could read in bed. This is probably the main reason we stayed for three days! The room is set back from the beach, so it was hot & we had to use aircon, which I don't like. Also the toilet sounded like the Tardis after you flushed it, which was kind of funny, but might upset a light sleeper.

Another nice feature was the upper balcony above the restaurant which was a colonial veranda with comfy chairs, a sea breeze, tables, wonderful wi fi and two huge bookcases. There were lots of mosquitos at night. Nyoman always brought a coil, though.

Sandy was friendly, offering lifts into town & Nyoman seemed sad that it was low season and we didn't want much looking after. Another reason to enjoy staying here.

And, although the couple of meals we tried in the restaurant were dull, the breakfast was delicious: the best coffee of the trip, hot breads with real butter and home-made jam or lemon cheese.

The hotel is at the end of a lane which gets very little traffic, so it was mercifully quiet.

To sum up: very much worth a try. It is idiosyncratic, with a mixture of plus points and oddities, but if it worked for you, you'd love it.
title: Peaceful, Friendly Place

text: My only regret is that we did not stay. I am considering going back right now instead of other places we have booked. The owner is a most beautiful and classy lady. The staff are so pleasant and ready to serve your every need. There is no better food anywhere in lovina, and the prices are low. We would not eat anywhere else after this experience. The cleanest, classiest, and most relaxing place in Bali. You cannot find a better place. Thank you so much Villa Agung Beach Inn! You are greatly missed!
title: You won't find a better place!!

text:
We've just enjoyed another 9 nights at the delightful Villa Agung, staying in our usual room. As always, we enjoyed every minute of our time there. Sandy, Gus, Nyoman and the girls are all so welcoming and it's a real joy to spend time chatting to them all.

Rooms are very clean, spacious and the hotel is very quiet. Towels and bed linens are of good quality and towels are now changed daily. Hot water is plentiful and very hot. There is good wifi in all rooms at no extra charge.

The hotel restaurant serves amazing food, both in quality and price. There is also a selection of wine and cocktails available at excellent prices Tables are beachside to catch the breeze and there is a small bar with attractive white cane furniture which is a wonderful place to enjoy a drink while watching the sun set over Java.

We are in the planning stage of our next trip to Bali....which will definitely include another stay at Villa Agung
title: Another delightful stay

text: Stayed October 2024 for the third time. Owners Gus and Sandy are very welcoming and will do everything they can to accommodate you. The food at the restaurant is top notch. It is literally on the beach, metres from the water. It only has seven rooms. It has a small but inviting pool in a small but appealing garden setting. Their handyman/gopher, Nyomen, will arrange anything you want - boats for dolphine cruise, fishing, transport, car hire - you name it he'll arrange it. We were ther 4 days this time but could easily have stayed longer.
title: A little gem

photos.caption: Picture from a boat showing reataurant area down stairs and leisure lounge upstairs

text:
We loved it here. Gus and Sandy (the owners) are such nice people, and because they are American, you can ask them everything. They do everything to help you and please you. The kitchen is great, really good, the breakfast super and the rooms are big enough. But the best here is the peacefulness, you have your breakfast on the beach with a sunrise you will never forget. 
This place will be one of the places we will come back to!
title: Peaceful, quiet and romantic...

photos.caption: The terras in front of the ocean

text:
We arrived to Villa Agung with no expectations as we have been winging our trip throughout Bali and we were so delighted to stay here for a peaceful and fun stay.
Our hosts Gus and Sandy are fantastic, so welcoming and helpful in everyday plans. All the little details to help us with our stay in Lovina were suggested, and lifts were available to town when they were heading that way themselves.
