This place is like home from home, for us Irish this is so welcoming as we felt we were part of the Agung family, all the staff are fantastic in particular Nyoman, what a character...
Thank you again for a memorable part of our trip to Bali. 
Jadzia and Shayne
title: A lucky find

text:
We are staying here for four nights. First impression was OMG, where are we, but we soon found out we were in a little haven away from the noise, of the main road and thats what we love. We were given a family room after finding the fan in the room we booked was noisy and the aircon remote did not work.we are very happy to have a ground floor room which is much larger than the original one. The staff are very kind. Nyoman is very helpful, always asking if we need anything.
Food here is very good, with a large menu to choose from..we met Sandy, one of the owners who was a great source of knowledge. It is great to have someone who knows the area so well.thankyou to everyone at Villa Agung
title: Small, quiet hotel

text: We live in Bali and as the kids were on holiday, we visited Tree Tops in Bedugul.  Its an excellent place for both adults and kids.  We decided to stay in Bedugul, but the accommodation available was either full or poorly maintained, not worth staying.  We decided to wing it to Lovina. Stopping at various hotels and resorts pricing places and checking them all out until we found this little place, Villa Agung Beach Inn.  Its small, homely, right on the beach, you cannot get any closer!  The owners greeted us, the Balinese staff were so genuinely welcoming.  We felt we had landed in old Bali, a little oasis.  Our 2 young kids were in heaven.  The room was clean, large, had a fridge, TV, dining table, bunk bed and a kingsize for us. Nothing modern about it and could do with a few fixes, but that made it rather Bali quaint.  Fairly priced for the area as it included breakfast.  Dinner that night was excellent! We hired a boat in the early morning to go dolpin siting, all organized with the staff.  Great Stay, Great Value, Highly recommended.  We will go back.
title: Lucky find....

text:
We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed our time here.  As others have mentioned, the hotel is tired looking, but still a great place to stay.  The location is very quiet but the town of Lovina is accessible if you desire nightlife and shopping.  

Gus (the owner) took us into town, free of charge, one day and we walked back ... but when he saw us walking, he pulled over to give us a ride back!  However, we later arranged a ride to town with Nyoman and were surprised when we were asked to pay him and the amount he charged us!  So, it is prudent to ask the cost of anything and everything here.  

The other staff were truly wonderful and authentic.  The girls genuinely cared and it was evident in all communications with them.  The food at the hotel was great!  The room was cleaned each day as well as the courtyard (which was very charming).

One of the best parts of staying here was the guide that Gus put us into contact with for our transfer from the south to Lovina.  Wayan was an amazing guide, the real deal, and made our trip an amazing experience!  We used him for four days and he showed us the real Bali.

I recommend this hotel for the quiet and relaxing atmosphere, the friendly and genuine staff, and the owner that is very hands on and makes you feel welcomed.  We will stay again!
title: Quiet and Relaxing

text: Sandy and Gus the owners operate a very personal service, the location is fairly isolated but on a beautiful beach.  The property itself is a little tired but the bed was great.  No wifi in rooms, only available in the restaurant over looking the beach.  No telephones in rooms or TV in rooms and the air conditioner struggled a little. I was happy not having a TV in my room but I had to go downstairs to access wifi, no phone was an issue with me as I was unwell with bronchial asthma so I stayed only 1 night.  Menu was average, the breakfast, limited in choice, but it was good.
title: Lovely location, a bit isolated.

text:
Location:
Villa Agung Beach Inn is a relatively small, family hotel located directly at the beach of Lovina Bay. Sitting in the restaurant or on the terrace you have a great view over the bay. Simply superb!!!
On the other side, this hotel is in the middle of nowhere, so if you wanted to dine or shop outside - there is nothing. 

Rooms:
Nice, spacious and clean but a bit worn.

Staff:
Excellent, friendly and helpful. And not the staff only - the owners are also there: friendly and happy to have a chat with their guests.

Food is ok. but not something to be remembered.

As a summary I would say it is a decent 3 stat hotel which, thanks to its beachfront location, is worth the fourth star :).
title: Nice location, friendly owners and staff

text:
Villa Agung is located in one of the most beautiful and peaceful spots in Bali. A glass of wine at the sunset bar, right on the beach, while watching the sunset over Java with fishing boats in the foreground....it just doesn't get any better.

This was our 4th stay at this tiny hotel, and we had 8 relaxing nights in our regular room which was always well cleaned and more than comfortable. Linens are changed every three days, although it's easy to ask for clean towels more often if required. We  just popped ours on the drying rack located right outside our door, and they remained fresh.

The library area above the restaurant has been upgraded, new open walls and a new roof and big comfy chairs and tables inside. It allows much better ocean views from the upstairs rooms, and is great for having a massage with a cooling ocean breeze wafting through.  Pool and beach chairs have also been replaced with very smart white rattan ones which makes the whole downstairs area look very nice.

We ate all our meals at the restaurant - they are so good, why bother to go anywhere else. Prices are tax inclusive and very reasonable. Every meal was excellent, there was not a meal that either of us could criticise in any way except that the deserts are so tempting and taste so good that we had one most nights, much to the detriment of our waistlines. The breakfasts are lovely, fruit or juice, eggs cooked to order and a basket of home made breads with butter and home made strawberry jam. And you're eating just a few feet from the ocean.

Many thanks to Gus, Nyoman and your wonderful staff of girls who looked after us so very well. We are sorry to have missed Sandy who was away, and we look forward to seeing you all again in a few months when we return to this little slice of paradise.
title: Another wonderful stay

text: It was a great time there at Villa Agung. It is right at the beach and you can have your breakfast and massage with a sea view. The garden is tiny but nice. The staff there are very friendly. They help to call massage in and book dolphin tour of next day. Lucky to see so many wild dolphins there in the morning with a beautiful sunrise. The best part is to relax at the beach side and it is very quiet. The only thing to note is that it is located 5km far away from central lovina and you need to take taxis after 6 pm because all bemos are out at night. The taxi may cost you IDR 40,000 or 50,000 per car for one way.
title: Great place to have a peaceful relax

text: We loved Villa Agung, beautiful big rooms with beautiful bathrooms. A lot of common place, nice little pool and a big selection of books. Breakfast is great on the terrace overlooking the ocean. Free wifi is available when the neighbours have their system running. Very helpfull in arranging tours around Bali. Far from central Lovina, which is nice because it's not too touristy but there are enough restaurants nearby.
title: First class service for a budget price

text: just had my third vist to villa agung beach inn, I love this place, the owners sandy and gus are great, very helpful, i have said before how much i love this place and why, this time i will show you why in photos
title: A little piece of paradise.

photos.caption: tea and coffee making, fridge at the back is the bathroom,
restaurant is bch front, plenty of sunbeds, shade or sun its up to you
ny ground floor room, great ocean view
upstairs in front of the rooms at night
one of the upstairs rooms where i stayed on my first visit

text:
After 3+ hours of driving in the dark on winding mountain roads, we arrived at Lovina's Villa Agung Beach Inn.  We checked in at 8:30PM and were starving.  Although the kitchen was already closed, the staff re-opened the kitchen for us because they didn't want their guests to go hungry.  Shower layout was a bit odd...because there is no curtain or shower glass, the water splashed everywhere so be extra careful when walking on the bathroom tile after someone showers...it's wet and slippery!  We met the owners, Sandy and Gus, the next morning at breakfast and they were super sweet.  The location of the villa is just steps from the volcanic black sand beach, next to the Bali Sea.  It's very charming and laid-back.  Definitely recommend for travelers wanting a different Bali experience.

PS - If we had waken up earlier, we would have had the chance to go out on the outriggers and see dolphin feeding...but we overslept.  Lovina, we'll be back!
title: Accommmodating staff

text:
Ok, the rooms are simple (say backpackershotel) but really comfortable. If you're with kids, they can stay at bunk beds and you have your own outdoor bath room.

What makes this hotel really nice is that it is perfectly located right at the beach. So you'll enjoy  drinks at the bar while watching the sunset. Add to that the really good & tastefull menu and the nice hosts, Gus and Sandy. And there you have this lovely place!  
And if you have any doubts about the size of the pool: we didn't hear the kids about the pool being too small, they enjoyed it as much as any other. And about the delphin watching: the jukung (fishers boat) picks you up right at the beach in front of the hotel. How easy is that?
title: First class sunset

text:
My Bali trip started off  fantastic and only got better by the day whilst staying at Villa Agung
in North Bali.

From the kitchen Ladies to the maintence and the beach sellers to the owners .

I can not  stop praising this one place which has set my memories of bali forlife and it is here it will be,I come everytime i  am in Bali.

Leo and friends and others that sold to Me and the owners Sandy n Gus were just fantastic.

Nyoman the handyman ?  No way, Nyoman the Greatest organiser there is for trips and 
tours and  sightseeing and  getting to know the place.......He is just the perfect compliment to Bali and more copies  should be made of him.

Lovina and the hotel Villa Agung, from meals to rest to sightseeing to adventure and dancing, it has it all and if A rest is what you are after, then head to Villa Agung in North Bali.

Cost from denpasar bali to Lovina for 2 people 500k about 3-5 hrs in a   taxi and  can make as many stops on the  way as your travelling there.

Despite the negative reports or feedback if there are any, You can take my and my partners word for it, two fussy aussies.

Lovina is rest and recreation retreat from kuta/legian and  it is a touch of paradise to be experienced to be believed.

Afurther indepth review to follow upon returning to Melbourne Australia to follow.
title: Review-Praise For Villa Agung.

text:
Hotel is right on the beach and you get to see the amazing sunsets in their relaxing viewing area.  Staff were great and we ended up eating at the hotel everynight.  Owner was on hand to answer any questions and give advice, great host!
Rooms were a little basic - but for the price fantastic - 2 balconies, good walk in shower, aircon etc.
A couple of things to note:
Lovina town is a bus ride away (cheap and easy though)
Pool on the website looks great - it is very small though
I loved shopping from my sunbed on the beach - but that's not for everyone! The locals visit daily to offer their goods - and if you barter you can get some great deals on clothes!

Overall would recommend - it was a fantastic base in Lovina, staff, service, views were fantastic!
title: Hotel is right on the beach and you get to see the amazing sunsets

text: The Villa Agung is a wonderfull small Hotel with a small Pool in a nice garden directly on the beach. The american Host is a very nice man. He likes to be with his guest to answer questions and to give them the fealing being welcome and home. His charmant and special way makes everything easy. The rooms are clean and well furnished. The employees are very friendly and the food is delicious and fresh. You can book trips for reasonable prices. A place to come back.
title: Very good price-achievement relation

text: Really nice hotel with everything we required for a few days break. Ideal place to stay to go on the Dolphin boat trip for R70,000 pp. If you have already booked elsewhere on  a package in Bali it would be worthwhile considering booking in at this hotel and doing the dolphin trip rather than paying the extortionate trip rates from Kuta, Seminyak, etc. - it would probably be cheaper and you can get a sightseeing tour (inc. Mengwi, Ubud, the twin lakes, waterfalls, temples, etc.) on the way there and back by hiring a car and driver (between $400-500,000 per day) especially if there are 4 of you.
title: Lovely hotel with direct access to the beach, great food, etc.

photos.caption: Sunrise boat trip to see the dolphins

text: Perfect place for a relaxing holiday. Owners are very attentive. Food is very good but bit costly. Lovely view as it is right on the beach. We stay in a a/c family room which was very clean. Nothing special about the beach as it is very narrow, quite dirty and not fit for swimming. We have a great dolphin spotting trip which we enjoyed very much. Nice place to stay for a family trip to Lovina.
title: Lovely small resort in a secluded part of Lovina.....

photos.caption: Wonderful view of the sea from the restaurant

text: While not a bad experience, we found fault with a few things at the hotel. We were one of only two guests at what is a 12-16 room hotel staying two nights. For our first breakfast, we were given a menu with the two options but when we ordered, we learned that one option was out—amusing and innocent but an indication of imperfect service. After the first night’s dinner—which we found fish over-breaded and fried (despite being mislabeled Balinese, which generally means grilled)--we were joined by Gus, the loquacious and opinionated expat owner for conversation. More because of the food, we decided to seek our second dinner at another beachfront restaurant in nearby Anturan. We spied the sole other guest also eating at the same restaurant. When we showed up for our final breakfast, we noticed that only two tables were set for breakfast with table clothes. Seated at one of these were the other guest and his kids. Seated at the other table was Gus, who remarked he had missed us the previous night. We were forced to eat our breakfast at a dirty unmade table. While the helpful scrapbooks and other useful information contributed to our stay, and we saw no real fault with Nyoman and the Balinese staff, we had the sense that not all paying guests were treated equally. We should also note that sheets and towels were not changed during our stay—good sense in an eco-resort but making for sandy bedding at a beachfront hotel.
title: Quirky

text: We stayed in Villa Agung for 2 nights and this place was just perfect. We arrived after an exhausting trip from Java and found this place very relaxing. It's right at the beach and you can literally step from the hotel into the water. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff is very nice and super friendly. It's a little off the Lovina tourism area, but that makes this place so relaxed and calm. We liked it very much and can highly recommend it.
title: Relaxed place right by the sea

text:
After reading comments posted on Trip Advisor we decided to make a reservation (3 nights) and paid our deposit. We were disappointed as when we arrived, after driving across Bali from Ubud, we discovered the place was substandard. It was under construction and inhabitable.
The staff did not know we were coming and couldn't find the reservation. After we showed a copy of the reservation and deposit receipt, they agreed to take us to view a room. We were even more disappointed when we saw the pool was filled with brown water and it looked like there were no other guests staying there. We felt duped. We took other accommodations. I would be leery of booking at a business that takes such a careless attitude with their guests. Not good customer service.
title: Book Here at your Own Risk - Value at What Cost

owner_response.text: As any of our guests, who have commented upon Villa Agung Beach Inn will attest, this accusation is grossly untrue.  We have renovated the big cottage ONLY and due to rain and high winds, what was scheduled to be finished before Christmas, was delayed.  All other rooms, totally refurbished, were available.  When we have heavy rains,sap from the trees darken the pool and we have had constant storms for 2 months. This lady arrived in the middle of a howling gale!  I have offered the return of her deposit, but have had no reply from her.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This place was a real pleasure to stay at. Lovely rooms with an outdoor bathroom. Which is nice although you can hear your neighbors go to the loo too. The people that worked there were very nice and the owner is very helpful too. He even dropped me off in town as this is about three km away. The view from the deck is very peaceful and a good place to hide from the hawkers on the beach. 
Food is nice too. The only thing I missed was a wifi connection but there are Internet cafes nearby.
title: Lovely quiet place to stay near lovina

text:
My family enjoyed a wonderful stay of 5 nights  at Villa Agung and basically didn't want to leave Villa Agung or Lovina! Villa Agung is right on the beach and just sitting on the beachside loungers watching the life on the beach and the ocean was relaxation in itself. Perfect sunsets, meeting locals, watching the fishing, kayaking etc etc.....

The hotel is a hidden gem and is so well priced it is amazing. Our family enjoyed the many spaces we could relax in - the beach side terrace, the pool and garden, the guest lounge with games and books, comfy chairs and incredible views. The rooms were spacious, clean and we loved the decor. Our rooms had 2 views - one onto the rice paddies and Lovina hinterland and the other onto the gorgeous garden courtyard and the ocean.Perfect!

We ate often in the restaurant and enjoyed all our meals - the variety was also good. Lovina central is a few kms away - you can catch a bemo or get a taxi on the main road. 

The staff at Villa Gung were all helpful and lovely and made our stay so special. 

Sandy (the owner) has created a haven of tranquility at Villa Agung and her attention to detail is everywhere. She is also able to give good advice and recommendations having lived in Lovina for many years.

Thanks to Sandy and Villa Agung for a wonderul and memorable start to our holiday in Bali!
title: Didn't want to leave!

text:
Well, my third visit to this great little boutique hotel. The rooms upstairs have had the bathrooms totally renovated, and look wonderful. The actual bedroom parts have been redecorated and look lovely and fresh. Downstairs, there are now two Family Rooms, with new open air bathrooms and separate sleeping areas(with a bunk bed) for children. A third Family Room will be renovated also, when time permits between guests. 
The Large Cottage will be renovated some time in the near future to make room for a couple more Family Rooms, which will make some more much needed room as Villa Agung was very busy this year in August. 
The Lounge/Library area above the Restaurant has had the floor restained, TV/DVD player, and Stereo included. More games have been provided for both Adults and Children. Very clean and tidy spot to while away some lazy hours.
Down in the Restaurant, the floor has been completely replaced, many new planters have been spread around there and the Pool Area. 
New items have been added to the Restaurant Menu, and there is now a choice of either a Fruit Plate or Eggs cooked in different ways for Breakfast(Complimentary), as well as other breakfast items on the Menu. 
I met many great people from all different parts of the world at Villa Agung. Some come overnight just for the Dolphin experience, and others stay for a week or more. You can be as busy or as slack as you like here. No pressure! Just relax.  I hope to be back here again next year.  Cheers Cheryl
title: Changes & Renovations at Villa Agung

text: The hotel is all good even to slightest details. Nice and clean room, the beach view is impressing esp the sunset moment. If you prefer a life of reading books and listening to the sea, the hotel will be perfect. Very quite, delicate and romantic. The restaurant really impressed mom and me. The starters and mains were all delicious with reasonable prices. Need a peaceful life to releae stress? Visit there.
title: a peaceful beach-front hotel with a terrific restaurant

photos.caption: balinese chicken curry and tuna satay

text:
We loved this place, so relaxing especially the lounge over the restaurant - we hardly left the hotel during our stay.

Our room was newly decorated and was beautiful, tea and coffee facilities were very welcome.

Hosts Sandy and Gus were great, doing everything possible to make our too short stay the best they could.  

Restaurant was too good ! I wanted to eat too much.

About 3kms? out of Lovina itself but this was no problem, bemos pass and transport is available.  Gus took us into Lovina one morning when he was running errands.

Overall nothing at all to complain of and we will definately return.
title: will return as soon as possible

text:
We really loved our time spent at this hotel. The owners, Gus and Sandy, were fantastic at making us feel at home and giving us good tips and advice for things to do, as well as some lifts in to Lovina/Singaraja. The staff at the hotel were all lovely and helpful. We really enjoyed the food here; with the included breakfast being a particular favourite with lovely fresh homemade bread to start the day.
The rooms were bright and cheery, with everything you need to make your stay very comfortable such as kettle, ac, mosquito net, etc. 
What great value- we miss it already!
title: Would return and recommend

text: I was travelling to a wedding in Lovina with two teenage girls.  We had the perfect family room.  The staff were sensational - finding an earring that I had lost, always with a smile.  Gus took us into town for a drive when he was going in for groceries, and also took us to an orphanage with all the food and clothing we had bought.  We relaxed, read a book upstairs in the library.  A special thanks to Nyomen who took us to his village and showed us the house he is building.  It is taking a while (because he buys the materials when he can afford them - so far 12 years), but when he has finished it will be fabulous.  The girls loved the Nasi goreng and we did eat there a few nights.  I would highly recommend this Villa as a lovely, friendly, safe, clean place to stay.
title: Gus and Sandy made us very welcome and we had a lovely time

text: I was looking forward to this place due to all the great reviews.  Firstly we arrived at the villa late around midnight.  As I'm pregnant, I requested for an air conditioned room with king or double bed.  When we arrived, the a/c doesn't work and they put two single beds together.  There were other rooms available with double beds next door unoccupied and we were the only other guests other than a german family downstairs.  Since it was so late and there wasn't anyone except the watchman, we couldn't say anything.  Breakfast was ok, it was watermelon and toast.  But the minute we sat down, we were harassed by hawkers on the beach.  It was definitely low season as the hawkers stayed for hours eventhough we said we weren't interested.  We had to go upstairs just to get away from them and the place hasn't been cleaned for years despite a full staff and few guests.  We were glad to move on to the next place which was so much better and better value.  The Anaheim Villas Lake Buyan.  There are some good things eg: the owner Sandy was very responsive on email, the car and driver she arranged was good and the manager running the place was helpful, he took us to a taxi who could take us to our next destination.  However, I don't feel that the beach was that great and the constant harassment isn't what we were looking for in a holiday.
title: Slightly Overrated & Can be better

owner_response.text: Arriving at midnight with no notice of late arrival or special requests, the security staff nevertheless would have given theguests the remote for the air conditioning.  They only had to ask.  As we are renovating the hotel, the other rooms they refer to were under construction!   NO ONE has ever complained about our breakfast, which is complimentary and the quality of home baked food is quite exceptional amongst similarly priced hotels. We apologise for beach vendors but we have no control over them, despite many complaints by us to the relevant hotel authorities.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I could not find much info about this resort on the internet. I booked it for the good price it offers. Upon arrival, my friends and I were surprised with the condition of the resort. It was clean, comfortable; and the staff is hospitable! 

The breakfast was the best I had in Bali! 
Will definitely stay here again if I go to Lovina again.
title: Comfortable resort by the beach

text:
The hosts Sandy and Gus have been wonderful. That sweet mix of British elegance and American entrepreneurship is a perfect ingredient for a nice stay in north Bali. We had our little 18 months kid with us and the 3 of us loved the place. The terrace on the beach is lovely, the cooking is great and it's good to be a little outside downtown Lovina - it's calm. They had an extra bed for the little boy, cool. 
If you have the chance to take a drink with Sandy and Gus at 6pm and watch the sunset, you will know exactly what we are talking about : it's a state of mind.
title: Friendliness, super service, great food and beautiful place

text: Stayed at Villa Agung for one night on a two day round the Bali coast trip.  Just walked in off the road and got great price.  Loved the small, homely feel of this hotel.  Only 6 rooms, pool and lovely restaurant over looking beach.  Nice to chat to owners Gus and Sandy who warmly welcomed us and took the time to chat!  Rooms clean and adequate, a/c, fridge and mosquito nets over bed. Food in restaurant is lovely - I had the fresh pasta which was divine.  Had our desserts and liqueur upstairs overlooking beach and fishing boats all lit up at night.  In the morning, wandered down the beach to see the fresh fish catch as the boats came in from morning fishing. Choice of 3 fresh breads for breakfast was a nice touch. Highly recommend this lovely homely hotel.
title: Good value for money - right on beach!

text:
We had a wonderful two week stay in this friendy, relaxed and intimate beach hotel. Our rooms on the ground floor were spacious and clean with a fridge full of goodies and a large bathroom. The food in the restuarant was good and varied. The balcony above the restuarant was great for watching the sunset as the fishing boats put to sea.
The staff and owners were very friendly and helpful, full of useful advice and useful tips to enhance the stay. The highlight was being taken to the local village temple to see children rehearsing the gamalan - far better than the tourist version in Ubud !!
The hotel is located right on the black sand beach, between two fishing communities. Sitting on the sand, drinking a Bintang and watching dogs and chickens paddling in the sea, was a delight. The main resort was a short bemo ride away (great fun given the smallness of the vans and the wideness of ourselves) and had more amenities and night life if you needed it.
title: Wondeful, relaxed and divine !!!

text:
This is a small property with a mix of rooms and traditional lumbung bungalows. The rooms are large with a large comfortable bed. In the room there is a fridge stocked with snacks and drinks for purchase, choice of A/C or fan, and a lockable cabinet. The bathroom is also large with a shower, toilet and basin. The rooms are light and airy with large windows and have a homey feel with home made wall hangings, window features and bed accessories.
The pool is small but the perfect size for the property and compliments the beach and sea only metres away.
The restaurant is fantastic. The food wonderful and presented with flare and attention to detail. Prices for meals are very competitive and considering the service and presentation, not to mention the quality, cheap by comparison. The included continental breakfast is very nice and different to the usual fare. Beverage, fresh fruit (very nicely presented) and a basket of homemade breads and loaves with jams and spread.
The studio above the restaurant is great for relaxing, watching the ocean, sunsets, playing games, reading etc. A very nice added feature.
I was especially impressed with how well trained the staff was at this property. Their attention to detail was amazing.
The owners, Gus and Sandy, are great hosts and Gus will, if you are interested, take you on a small tour of Lovina to show you the highlights and get you orientated. I really appreciated the time he spent with us and the things he showed us that we wouldn't have seen on our own.
title: Value for mony, great restaurant, wonderful hosts

text:
We stayed at Room 1 on the ground floor for 2 nights in Aug 09. 
Gus is a wonderful host who takes time to mingle with all guests and make us feel at home. He gave us a free ride into Lovina town when he went grocery shopping, and gave us good tips to find our way back via bemo ! 
Neumarn (hope i spelled it right) is another gem who really looked after us. Imagine being offerred hot tea, blanket, mosquito coil, beach cushion etc when you'r out by the beach looking at the stars! And he went out of his way to make sure we got the "best solution". Really grateful and appreciative for both their help.
The other staff were also friendly and helpful. Especially enjoyed the nice touches to our meals at the restuarant (see pix).
The only complaint was that the water pressure for the shower was a bit low, though still useable.
Overall, a nice relaxing place with fantastic folks, just steps away from the beach.
title: Peaceful Beachside Lodging with Great Hosts

text: My wife and I spent 2 weeks here in October of 2008.  Sandy was a great hostess and took extra time to show us around her village as well as Singhraja.  Great location away from the bustle of Kuta.  Local transport (Bemo) available to Lovina town.  Our second floor room was very comfortable and it was nice to have a frig in the room.  Pool was small but adequate.  Restaurant is top notch and is priced accordingly.  Entrees run 50,000 to 80,000 Rp but as I said, the food is excellent.  The only drawback to the hotel was lack of internet access but there are plenty of places in town.  Very nice staff.  Perama bus station is a short walk away.  If we return to Lovina, Villa Agung will be our place to stay.
title: Friendly Place

text: Couldn't be closer to the beach. Sandy and her staff welcomed us into their village for a glimpse of real Bali life. Went out of their way to go the extra mile. Couldn't have asked for a more relaxing stay. Rooms are clean and tidy. Restaurant is excellent.
title: Fantastically friendly

text: Great place to stay in Lovina!  It is literally right on the beach, but there is a small swimming pool as well.  The sunsets are gorgeous and there are plenty of places to sit and enjoy them.  Sandy, the owner, is very friendly and helpful.  You can tell that she is steadily working on the place and continually updating the accommodation and adding to the restaurant menu...  Speaking of which... The restaurant is very good.  They have everything from the traditional Bali tempeh and nasi goreng to the very British cottage pie.  The pasta was also very tasty and they make their bread fresh.  The rooms are basic.  So, just be aware of this, but are clean and complete with all the necessities.  Great value, all in all.  Would definitely recommend this place to family and friends!  Thanks, Sandy and the rest of the staff for a great few days holiday!
title: Friendly Little Place with Fantastic Sunsets and Tasty Food!

text: Not the best value in town at Rp. 200,000 (plus 10%) for a fan-cooled room but mine host Gus and the location compensate somewhat.  The pool is tiny (the website calls it 'intimate') but adequate provided not too many guests want to use it.  The beach is so-so; the food is excellent but also has 'Western' prices attached to it.  The absolutely best value in pure money-terms are the bungalows attached to the PERAMA bus-stop at Anturan on Lovina Beach.  They are well-appointed, either fan-cooled or air-conditioned bungalows with a large bathroom (including bathtub!) and cost a mere Rp. 80,000 which includes breakfast for - WAIT FOR IT! - TWO NIGHTS!!!  That's Rp. 40,000 a night or about AUS$5 a night for a proper bungalow of good standard.
title: Villa Agung slightly ageing

owner_response.text: The reviewer is mistaken in the fact that we charge European prices for food.  Our entrees start at Rp 20 000 to Rp 60 000 which is for imported meats.  All our food is made in house and made fresh by hand.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Great hotel on a quiet part of Lovina Beach, right on the beach. This means that you don't have to choose between pool and beach, you can have both. The restaurant has a good menu and the rooms are beautiful.
title: Relaxing hotel, right at the beach

text: This is the real Bali,absolute beach front and quiet.Owners and staff are amazing.The staff are treated more like family than employees.Food and drinks are great and at a realistic price.Awesome sunsets over the ocean.Perfect for a real holiday.
title: Amazing stay

owner_response.text: It was a delight having you stay with us and we really miss you.  Thank you.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Listed are the pros and cons:

Pros : Excellent location. Right by the beach.
Good looking place.

Cons: Average room. Small in size and basic amenities.
Food was strictly ok.

Lovina beach itself is a black sand beach. People flock here for the dolphin watch. Of which we had an awesome experience.
title: Best of the lot in Lovina

owner_response.text: Glad you liked the dolphins and our closeness to the beach.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We spent 3 days in Villa Agung. Just fantastic.
Quiet and calm atmosphere. Friendly staff, good service and clean rooms every Day. Good wifi.
The owners were very helpful and nice people.
The sunset from the patio is breathtaking.
Should We ever return to Lovina, there is No doubt, We will stay here again
title: Just amazing

owner_response.text: you were fun to have here and thank you for your praise.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Amazing place to stay, would highly recommend. The team at villa Agung made our stay personal and enjoyable. The accommodation was clean and serviced each day. The location is just outside Lovina, but that made no difference as we didn’t need anything we couldn’t of got at the hotel. The hotel is a little gem right on the beach in walking distance of restaurants.
title: Villa Agung beach inn

owner_response.text: So grateful for your kind words and hope to see you again someday.  Sandy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Villa Agung Beach Hotel is a nice place to stay. The owners Gus and Sandie make you feel like family. The rooms are fairly basic, but everything functions as it should and they were clean. The staff are very nice and try to be very helpful. Nyoman is great with the guests and Tony Putu leads a good yoga class if you want to join in. They can organise dolphin watch tours as well as other attractions if you want. Our beds were a bit squeaky, but generally the hotel was a nice place to stay. Seems like a place that regulars return to year after year. Our family felt at home here, and would definitely stay here again if we were returning to Lovina.
title: Family feel

owner_response.text: We like people to feel welcomed and part of our Bali family.  Thanks for the kind words and I'll investigate the squeaky bed!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed here 3 nights in 2 rooms.
This place is really great. The staff work hard to make your stay the best.
Nice room with a villa touch. Very clean. Brilliant breakfast with home made breads. Very good evening menu and wonderful beach side seating. Has a small pool.
This is a very friendly place to stay and highly recommended.
Best to have your own locally arranged transport as a few kilometres from restaurants.
Wonderful stay over 3 nights.
title: Brilliant family run guest house

owner_response.text: You make all the hard work of the staff worth it when you say such kind words.  Many restaurants will come and pick you up.  We have a list posted at the hotel  Otherwise Nyoman, our security, is always good for a ride and a laugh.  Just give him a tip!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This review is one of most easy to write. But I will anyway start with the beginning. When we arrived we got our room but we first have a little struggle with a little animal who hasn't booked a family room. The room was big and the air conditioner was good and silent. The pool was clean and had a perfect temperature. The breakfast was served with a great view over the sea. The menu card has a great variation and the food was always served with a smile. Overall we enjoyed the twelve days we have on Villa Agung Beach Inn, and if we ever returns to Bali we definitely will visit this little gem again.
title: Perfect places to stay

owner_response.text: We love that you stayed with us for twelve days and you were so easy to help and adventurous on your own.  Thanks a ton for the stars.  It helps us so much.  Sandy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I booked the villa with only the reviews and pictures to go by, when we arrived and were taken down a small road next to a rice paddie I was a little concerned. All for nothing! It is small clean and some of the nicest people work there.
It’s literally on the beach, so peaceful and perfect. Next time we visit up there we will stay longer.
title: Hidden treasure

text:
Pros: 
Wonderful and super friendly owner, Gus greeted us warmly eventhough we reached his place at 4am due to rescheduled flight and we don’t know how to reach him since we don’t have his contact.
His place is clean and neat, even their towels are cleaner than most hotels!
The breakfast was nice, the staffs too.
The pool is clean. Not to mention the beautiful view from the dining area. 
We really enjoy our short stay there, and we’ ll surely stay at his place again if we happen to come to Lovina in the future.

Cons: none. none. and none
title: We love our stays in here

owner_response.text: Sorry I missed saying thank you for your review.  It means a lot to us and is very helpful to future guests.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The place is lovely with spacious rooms and a very nice pool. It's located right on the beach and you can hear the waves gently crashing on the shores through the day and night. One sad part is it's a bit far from town - around 3-4 km so it's difficult to commute unless you hitch a ride with Gus, who runs the place, or rent bikes or a taxi. The food is great, though slightly more expensive than some of the other places we ate at. I personally loved the way the cutlery was tied with a leaf and presented on the table! The drinks are also a bit steep. The choice of music in the restaurant area is also very nice and adds to the ambience. If we stayed longer, I would have probably continued the routine of swimming in the pool, the sea, the pool, the sea and some more! The staff are friendly and cheerful and happy to help.
title: A nice leisurely stay by the sea

owner_response.text:
Hi Anusha666,


You are the perfect guest!
Please come back soon :)
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We went with family and friends for a nice Sunday lunch and as usual we had a great selection of local and western food, John Dory Fillets were fantastic. Drinks at reasonable prices staff always happy, they gave made many improvements in menu and actual property.. A must go to for good food.. Hotel looks great now also.
title: Extremely good food

text:
Having seen other reviews I feel mean to consider rating the hotel as 'average' though I don't feel our stay was 'very good'. 
The positives: beautiful beach front setting; lovely private pool with ample loungers; friendly helpful and hardworking staff; good air con & wifi; great dolphin and snorkelling activities arranged by Nyoman. The negatives: we were taken to a room on the 1st floor though it wasn't ready when we got to it, so were given room 1 and I'm not sure the room was what we booked/paid for (Deluxe Double Room, 1 King Bed, Terrace, Sea Facing); the shower needed modernisation; our quality of sleep was affected by the amount of light in the rooms with the curtain set up that I've seen in other reviews and the local and hotel dogs barking at 04:30-6am on two of our three night stay.
 
We enjoyed our stay and feel with a few improvements the experience could be enhanced further.
title: Mixed feelings

owner_response.text: showers have been totally redone and our windows now have double curtaining to block all light.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This hotel is marvelous and the owner/managers Gus and Sandy and all their staff are amazing and super friendly. In fact probably this is one of the most friendly hotels I have ever stayed in.

 We stayed here with friends to celebrate my partner's birthday and they organised a cake for us to be brought out for his birthday lunch which we had at the hotel. The food is of a good standard and there are also beers, wine, spirits and a few cocktails to tempt you. The restaurant closes a little early around 8pm, but probably because it was a little quiet and there are plenty of restaurants close by with a short walk on the beach. 

The hotel is beachfront on a nice clean beach and there is a double floor pavilion on the beachside for relaxing, eating and chilling out. Behind this is a  beautiful and new swimming pool with plenty of sunbeds. There are some nice new family rooms to the side of the pool and and six older rooms at the back, all overlooking the pool and beach area. The hotel seems to be going through an ongoing maintenance program and the older rooms are getting a lick of paint. There is obviously a big effort to keep this hotel looking good.

They do a nice daily breakfast with homemade breads and jams and if you want extra there is also an extra breakfast menu with extra items.

They can organise your trips from the hotel and all are reasonablly priced. Our friends enjoyed the dolphin trip that leaves a bit later to avoid the earlier morning rush. 

We will definately be going back sometime in the near future to experience some more of this relaxing hotel and the amazing hospitality.
title: Wonderfully Relaxing Beachfront Hotel

owner_response.text: It was such a  joy to have you all and I am glad the cake went down so well (and so were the staff for the rest of the cake!)  You really make all the hard work we put in worth it and we would love to have you back again,  maybe for good old English Christmas dinner.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: There are 9 rooms, 6 of which are older and need a little upgrading, which the owners appear to be doing now.  The outside areas are very nice, already upgraded, and right on the beach.  The owners and staff are the friendliest I have seen in a hotel.  Breakfast is simple, but ample and good.
title: Very Friendly Beach Front Hotel

owner_response.text:
it is always nice when the guests arrive and can enjoy themselves . mike is correct , as the owners are always upgrading the hotel , and we look  forward to the response from the guests . the responses we receive are always helpful and are never negative in nature . thank you mike .
sincerely 
gus hochrein
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I stayed here 23/08/17 - 28/08/17 and loved it. My friend with whom I traveled, was a returning guest which influenced my reason to stay. 
Compared to the other areas of Bali it was very quiet, not so in your face, and a very simple place to be.
Our room on the top floor was clean and quiet, and pleasantly furnished. The bathroom was large and although the water flow was erratic in the shower, it was good enough. The balcony overlooked the lovely pool and dining area, and also had a lovely patio to sit quietly and have coffee in the morning. The free wifi was good.
Dining in was enhanced by being situated a stones throw from the crashing waves, and the food was good, and tasty. I loved the fresh baked bread at breakfast accompanied by home made jams. My favourite was the lemon butter.
The pool was gorgeous, the upstairs verandah straight from colonial times with a view to die for, and a sun-downer with host, Gus, watching the fishermen boating out for the night, a memory that will stay with me forever.
The beach sellers weren't too intrusive, and there were ladies to give massages, hair treatments or pedicures nearby.
The staff were amazing, happy and friendly, and Gus a very gracious host.
Looking forward to returning again next year.
title: Far from the madding crowd...

owner_response.text:
it is always nice to hear from our guests , as we use the feed- back to improve our hosting details .
tricia and her friend were great guests , active and always interested in the culture of bali .
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Black rice pudding, it was a bit yummy!
Gin and Tonics watching the sun set over Java

text:
This is a great place. We had a family room including breakfast. The rooms are clean, bright (curtains against daylights missing, but okay), with safe and fridge. Personell was really nice. Good breakfast. Gorgeous view from restaurant,  out of the rooms we saw pool, restaurant and ocean behind, fantastic). 
Gus is the american manager and was really helpful. One day there was a problem with the pool and he organized that we and the kids could swim in another place (he even gave us the money for entry).
Over the beach there is close access to nearby restaurants, Warung Rasta is recommended.
title: Reommended

text: I have been coming to Villa Agung since 2008. It is still the lovely little Boutique Hotel it always has been. My friends and I had a family room downstairs this time, as there were three of us, so needed extra beds. The room was great, lovely and clean as usual. Plenty of room for the three of us. We were there to rest, relax and recover, not to run all over the countryside visiting places. And boy, did we relax. No TV in the rooms there, but who needs it, when you can read, sit up in the breezy deck above the restaurant and watch the world go by? We enjoyed our RRR time there. Gus and Sandy still the great hosts as usual. The food is still wonderful, and it was great to see all the lovely Villa Agung staff again. My friend who is a Coeliac, was helped greatly by the staff with Preparation of Gluten Free food. Well done. Our time to go came way too soon, and hope to be back again in 2017. 😀
title: Still love Villa Agung

text:
Such an amazing place with amazing people. This was the highlight of my Bali trip. I will always cherish my one night stay at Villa Agung. It is such a beautiful place with amazing hospitality. We came to Lovina and instantly fell in love with this little town. The true Bali experience. Lovina is a quiet town which closes very early everyday. Villa Agung is right on the beach. The rooms are very clean and pretty and spacious. And the balcony have sea view. The food was very very delicious. I fell in love with the food the girls cooked. And they are welcome you like their family, we didn't knew the town closes so soon so we didn't order anything. Later we realised that everyone has left. So, Nyoman's son helped us in making noodles. He opened his kitchen for us. It was so sweet. And then they also arranged the dolphin tour early morning and also a cab to take us back to Kuta. 

I loved my stay there and wouldn't think twice before coming back.
title: I am in love with this place.

photos.caption: One of the best coffees i had here at Villa Agung

text: Arrived here after luchtime, long rough driveway from main road entrance along paddy fields and met by kitchen staff, no actual reception office. Moved to upper room with steep stairs and heavy bags lugging up difficult by us, no staff to help out. basic room, bed comfortable with good pillows, no tv in room as only in main villa room downstairs apparently. Mentioned the tv situation to staff and they disclosed none in our room, also found out we was suppose to get lower larger family room but had been doublebooked, happens a bit apparently here. was offered by Gus another new location along beach for 2nd night which we inspected and was ok, it had a better larger pool there and rooms  were new. We had diner at Villa Agung, good basic meal and not overpriced, had great variety of meals available for such a small location, the Bintang beer was nice and cold especially on  the upper level watching sunset. No bar fridge in room. No safe in room. The room had great fan over bed as small air con was around corner in the entrance door area. The  breakfest meal was  basic in morning. Wi Fii basic seemed to go off and on,especially best for reception was outside on balcony area. Pool area small and clean. Room had great folder on Villa Agung location and the surrounding areas of whats available and when, real helpful. Small store and feul station about 10 minute walk along main Singaraja road.
title: Room doublebooked, moved to another location after 1 night

text:
Relaxing stay at Villa Agung with a fresh clean room and very attentive staff. 
Hosts Gus and Sandy were helpful giving us lifts to see a weaving factory and shopping. 
Wonderful dinner conversation and catch up. They even catered for my gf diet. Enjoyed relaxing and listening to the waves rolling up on the beach. Didn't swim in the pool however my friends did and found it very clean and refreshing.
Wonderful spot away from the rush and bustle in the south
title: Relaxing

owner_response.text:
It is always lovely to have you and thanks for the kind words.  
The girls really tried with the gluten free diet with a few surprises!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Well i booked this place months ago , Got there and there was confusion in what room i was getting, I can understand things are never perfect, Anyway i decided to go back to Legian as i did not get what i expected and what i booked , What i can say about this place is if you want to stay there is go there have a look at the place ,if you don't like it leave and thats an honest opinion but make sure you have back up places to go to. I must admit it did look different to what the photos showed that changed my view on the place. Even my driver was shocked at what happened with the room confusion ,he to was not impressed.One tip from me to the owners is the Kitchen should not double as front office very unprofessional, Again my driver just laugh at that sorry but true.
title: My so called stay did go to plan

text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with standard room only to get a family room.  Sounds better but is not size that I look for but facilities in the room though that really caught me by surprise.  An over rated 4 star is definitely a joke with no tv, bidet spray inside toilet with toilet bowl way too low. Breakfast which only serve western food, no local food, come on we are in indonesia right?  Totally not ideal for muslim travellers.  Even drivers room at low rated hotel has a tv and bidet spray, but this is not the case.  If this happens at non muslim majority country, I can understand, but here in indonesia which has largest muslim population, this hotel only caters certain group of people.
title: Overrated with poor facilities

text:
You know what it's like... You find a lovely little hotel, rave about it and next time you want to stay it's fully booked!
This is a great place to stay. Friendly and knowledgeable American & British owners who are at the attached restaurant every morning and evening to chat with guests and offer advice. 
Some of the best home cooked food ever had in Bali. Homemade pasta, breads and jams. 
Comfortable and clean beds, loved the outdoor bathrooms. 
We've stayed twice and will stay again.
title: Hidden gem

text: The hotel is situated near a busy road, the rooms terribly decorated and flies all over my face in my room. The sea is full of rocks, we did not like the food at all and the rooms are noisy. Lovina itself is quite depressing.
title: Not what I expected at all

text: I don't know what planet the other reviewers were on, but my 4 night stay here recently was truly the most awful experience I have ever had in all of my traveling experiences all over the world. The worst part was the extremely strong stench of sewer water coming out of all of the pipes in the bathroom. It was more putrid. It was sickening. Just trying to take a shower or wash my hands and face at the sink was disgusting and made me dry heave with the overpowering sewer smells.  And speaking of that, I became very ill with "Bali Belly" from eating the food here--fever, vomiting and diaerra. The room was dusty, unclean and musty smelling. The entire time I was there there was world war 3 deconstruction going in in the units below me, deafening and unrentless noise. The entire place was in major disrepair and in need of major renovations and repairs. The beach front was filthy, with trash strewn everywhere. It was my worst experience in Bali, by far. I will never go back again, and I would never send anyone there. It was just plain horrible. Ugh. Disgusting. Yuck.
title: Ugh! Horrible!

owner_response.text:
Unfortunately, this lady was more attached to a wine bottle than reality!  She stayed up until all hours imbibing.
We couldn't gain access to her room to clean as she was always sleeping!
She made several bookings for tours and cancelled later with short notice as she wasn't up to it.
She accused my girls of theft which is absolutely untrue.  They have been with me from the onset sixteen years ago.
Her 'Bali belly' was a result of too much wine and not enough sustenance.  She only ate tomato soup here which is freshly made and hardly likely to cause an upset stomach.
her bathroom aroma is inexplicable and the first I heard of it is in this review.  I will investigate.
We are doing some renovation, which is the only truthful part of this review.  Not good for a hangover!
Unfortunately there are very unhappy people in this world and whatever this lady was seeking in Bali, obviously did not materialize.  Hence this attack!
As a hotel we are solely at the mercy of people with a grudge and I know that our other guests will see this for what it is.
Unfortunate
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We spent five glorious days in this peaceful location. Villa Agung offers excellent value, clean rooms and great food. This is a fabulous base from where you can explore the north, or take a short drive to Lovina, or just relax in the gazebo overlooking the Bali Sea cooled by gentle winds. A boat can pick you up right at the front to take you dolphin watching. One evening we walked to a neighbouring restaurant and sat around a fire whilst three Balinese men played guitar and sang a mixture of Balinese folk, Bob Marley, Eric Clapton and more.  Sandy and Gus are excellent hosts and I enjoyed our conversations. The staff are very helpful. I fell in love with Whiskers.  Once a street dog, he has found his place at Villa Agung and he had us in fits of laughter with his antics. Thank you All for giving us a beautiful, memorable and heart felt experience.  It was difficult to leave however we shall return.
title: Wake up to the ocean, paddy fields and mountains

photos.caption: View of fishing boats and beach

text: We have been here 7 times and will be back. This hotel is on the Beach - you can't get it better.  The good is som of the best good you can  gået on Bali. Everything is home made with love and that is what you taste. The staff   is the best helpfull and big smile.  The overs are wonderful.  Thank you.
title: On the Beach :)

text:
We loved our 4 night stay, great spot right on the beach, friendly staff, lovely food.  Gus and Sandy are so friendly and welcoming, and happy to take you on a little tour of the area, or allow you to tag along when they  run their errands, and give you a taste of local village life.

We used Wayan for our transfers to and from Villa Agung, and he was very helpful with great information to share.  Our kids had such a great time here, they cried when we had to leave.  

On a side note ....  We visited the local water park near lovina - don't go !! Green pools, not much shade, very disappointing .
title: Great Place, friendly staff.

text:
Before booking here I read the "Terrible" reviews and discounted them all.  What a great decision that was.  I am not sure what their issues were but they must have stayed at another place to us!!  Now if you're expecting anything other than a small homely, beachfront hotel with the most friendly local staff, you'll be disappointed.

Villa Agung Beach Inn is a wonderful place run for 17 years by Gus (American) and Sandy (British) who made us feel welcome from the second we arrived.

I was travelling with 2 daughters (14 & 12) who really enjoyed the place too.

The room was spacious, with a comfortable bed (no TV in our room, which we were happy about) and air conditioning.  Being a small hotel, it was all very personal and we met other guests who have been coming back every year for the last 5 years.  I can understand why.

I could hang here for a week, just chilling by the beach and enjoying life.

There's internet available throughout and good advice on local activities (including the ones to avoid).

As someone who spends about 100 nights a year in hotels and has been doing that for 20 years, I was VERY happy with what we got at Villa Agung Beach Inn and will very likely return.

Thanks Gus & Sandy for your personal service.
title: Wonderful friendly small place in Lovina

text: The place is typical for 3-star hotel. I liked the beachfront private terrace overlooking the ocean, with massage lady offering me bali traditional massage, it was relaxing. I didn't like the cloudy and grey rose wine they served me at the restaurant thou. We smelled sewage water and heard Bahasa announcement done for a long time on a loud speaker next door at night by the beach. But the service was impeccable. Could stay there again.
title: value for money

owner_response.text: I regret the disturbance for our guests but I believe the chanting was from the fishing village nearby as a celebration for their temple.  It only happens very occasionally and is part of Balinese culture.  Villa Agung Beach Inn.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
At the risk of being redundant, the place is GREAT. During my year in Jakarta we made two trips; the first with my partner then a return by myself. Could I figure out out how to do it I'd spend at least 6 months a year here. Maybe next year. In the meantime I hope that they are not overrun with guests  (although they deserve it!) so that there will be space for me (us!)

It is small, friendly and most hospitable. To remind me every day I have a photo I took of sunset from the terrace bar at the desktop on my laptop. I hope that this helps other travellers to make the right choice!

If you are  staying elsewhere be sure to go for dinner!

If nothing else gets us there, then a honeymoon  next year!!!!

In case I forgot to say it the Villa Agung is GREAT!!!!! I
title: Great property; great location; great staff; great food; Great Hosts!!!

text:
I had the opportunity to stay at Villa Agung in February for 4 nights.  It was the slow season but you couldn't tell from the service or the condition of the property, rooms or restaurant.  The room had very comfortable beds, stayed clean and the air conditioner made for quiet cool sleep.  The locatoin right on the black sand beach was fantastic.  The rates were very low and the food was just as well priced.  

Gus and the staff are so friendly.  They really go out of their way to make sure everything is just right and if you have a request, they're happy to take care of it.  One of the folks with us became ill (nothing due to Villa Agung) and Gus was kind enough to offer another room so the roommate who wasn't ill would be able to sleep!  

I didn't use the massage services but others on our trip did and they reported that they were very nice and extremely affordable at about $10 per hour.  If you're looking for a quiet getaway with a great view and great family atmosphere on the North side of Bali, this is the place.
title: Villa Agung - Great!

text: After visiting in 2012, I was fortunate to revisit in Feb 2014. The hotel is right on the beach making it easy to load on for the dolphin trip at dawn. The food is amazing and hosts extremely friendly. Rooms are great. My room had a fan and air conditioner. Immediately, I have always felt at home coming to Villa Agung and look forward to returning.
title: Worth a revisit

text:
When we stayed here in september this place had really bad reviews and we couldn't understand why because this place is great! We paid 200 000 rph with a room with fan, and where a bit anxious.  But in Bali fan works great and this fan was awesome (lol). The pool is big and warm and the restaurant is ok. The sevice could have been better, but it worked. 
You got a lot for the money! I would definitely stay here again. The snorkelingtrip they offer is also very good. The dolphinwatching though, you can skip. It more seemed like a dolphinhunt. 
Anyway, stay here if you're on budget and want a good place.
title: Great for budget, and surely otherwise as well

text:
Seriously - why would you bother sweating it out with the Aussie yobbos in Kuta/Legian when you could come up north and spend a week or two here?

It had been 26 years since my then girlfriend / now wife and I had come back to Lovina. What a wonderful surprise to see it via the Villa Agung.

You're right bang smack on the beach. It is small, tidy, clean and family-friendly. The food and service are just excellent. You're surrounded by a wealth of Balinese heritage intermingled with fascinating Dutch & Japanese colonial history. The locals are friendly, the marine and other wildlife is prolific, and you're but a short drive to some of the most spectacular (and largely unvisited by westerners) waterfalls, mountain villages and temples in all of Bali.

And best of all, it appears to be a completely yobbo-free zone.
 
The owners are terrific, and though they live next door, they spend alot of time mixing with their guests and being extremely attentive to their staff and their property. They eat there too, which in my books is a pretty good recommendation. Gus - American, political, funny and engaging - is great value. Much more interesting than your regular bland hotel type. His partner Sandy is English, urbane, socially-connected within the community and one very cool lady.

I think what I enjoyed too was the 'realness' of the place. Not everything was perfect all the time - a few things went bung, the downstairs room was kinda cozy for a larger family, and a cat turned up to sleep beside me one night (having sneakily come in through the gap above the bathroom).

But so what.  

Everything is clean & comfortable. The food is generous, fresh and reasonably-priced. The pool is cool and refreshing. The traditional hut library is full of interesting books. The views and the sunsets are just beautiful. And everyone is helpful, friendly and very eager to ensure that your stay is as relaxing and memorable as it can possibly be.

What more could you ask for?
title: Avoid the south - head north!

text:
Selected this Beach-Inn because of it's good reviews on TripAdvisor. And it was the right decision to spend remember-able family holidays which included Dolphin watching, hot springs and hiking/bathing in the waterfalls (all within a radius of approx 15km). Despite the withe sand is missing on the beach the area is inviting for interesting activities and good restaurants can be found. Recommend you to explore the area with a rental car.
The hotel itself gives you a very warm and welcoming feeling as the owners, Sandy and Gus run it with passion. Our room was simple and it provided sufficient space for 4. I liked to have my breakfast or dinner on the sea-side terrace in a picturesque ambiance. 
The children felt absolutely free and enjoyed much the small pool or the sea. Gus took us to a close by  farmers house to see the local living conditions. Both, the owners as well as the staff took the utmost care for the personal well-being of our children and us. It was a lovely stay.
In the north of Bali we experienced some issues in getting cash out of the ATMs - in Singaraja we could finally find cash machines accepting international cards. Also a real supermarket (Carrefour) is available there.
title: lovely beach-inn

text: Stayed here with friends. Very cozy hotel with beautiful Lovina Beach view. Breakfast was nice, staffs were friendly. The owner arranged 2 hour morning boat ride for us to see dolphins. We found a group of about 10 dolphins we could see but they swam and jumped really fast and I only used a pocket camera. The Captain tried to keep the boat as steady as he could and provide the best view of the dolphins but still there's no dolphin captured in my pictures. A very fun and enjoyable way to spend the morning.
title: Cozy Hotel and Enjoyable Boat Ride

text:
The hotel is perfecly located : in a quiet zone right at the beach .  The rooms are spacious . Cleaning and towel change was done permanently on a daily base . Coffee and tea in the room was a nice bonus . Gus (the owner) always showed the good american hospitality - attentive to every single guest and thus making shure that everyone is satisfied . The restaurant is great : not a very long menue , but more than enough items . Delicious suppers every night , fish preparation was great ! One of the few places on Bali where we could order regular green salad with choice of dressings . Good breakfast . Overall , excellent hotel / restaurant , perfect point  to discover the northen part of Bali , I would suggest 3 overnights there . Thank you Gus for the great time , we hope we will be back !!!

   Regards : Hristina and Alex
title: Strongly recommend !!!

text: We stayed there for only 1 night. We reached there quite late because we were lost. Not because the hotel is hard to find but it was our first time being around Lovina. The staff welcomed us and we have a lovely dinner. I had fish as my dinner and it tasted so fresh. The next day we went to see the dolphin but we didn't see them. Man on the boat said it was too windy. We went back and had a lovely breakfast. Nice stay :) oh and nice and very informative owner.
title: First Timer in Lovina

photos.caption: lovina beach view in the morning

text: Picked this villa because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and wasn't disappointed, lovely stay the rooms where great big enough for our for our family of 4 adults, the food in the restaurant was great, the staff were great, Gus and Sandy were good hosts, if only the torrential rain had stayed away, didn't stop us from having a great stay there, would definitely stay again
title: Quick trip to Lovina

text:
We've just had 8 wonderful nights at Villa Agung - our third time here. This little hotel is perfect for relaxing and de-stressing.

We stayed in our regular room, details can be found in my previous review.

Once again, we ate all our meals at the hotel restaurant. Prices are good, and tax inclusive. Drinks are moderately priced as well. Sandy is currently training staff to make some new dishes, and being regular guests, we got to sample a couple of their first tries, before the new menu is available. It was nice to be asked to give our input into the new dishes.

Once again, host Gus was wonderful and we enjoyed our evening chats over a drink or two. And it was good to finally meet Sandy, who has always been away when we have visted in the past.

We have booked another week at Villa Agung for next year, but are already trying to work out how we can spend some extra time at this special little place.
title: Our third stay

text:
We only went to Lovina for the dolphins, but were very positively surprised. This is the one place we really wanted to stay during our Bali vacation. The hospitality of Sandy and Sandy, and of  Nyoman in their absence, was simply outstanding. The service from the Balinese girls were slipping a bit when Sandy and Gus were not there, but Gus fixed every issue we had.

The food was the best we had on Bali, and the sunsets are just to die for.

We had a four person bedroom, with an extra bed. The extra bed was rubbish, but otherwise we were OK with the accomodation.

We don't go back to places we've visited in the past, since we want to try new places, but if we ever go to Lovina again, Villa Agung will be where we stay.
title: Love the place

text: We stayed for 1 night only as our main purpose is to watch dolphin early morning before sunrise. Great location as the beach just opposite the villa, and few seconds were on the boat ride from the villa. Dolphin watching was great as we managed to get near the dolphins and took few pictures of it. The room is very clean and spacious. Location wise is ok as we walked to the warung rasta for dinner which was 10mins walk from the villa. there are convenience stores opposite the villa also, The owner is very friendly and we feel at home. The breakfast is very simple and small portion. Totally worth for your money!
title: Relaxing place for stay and dolphin watching

text: We didn't actually stay here but our hotel was next door and we ended up visiting every day for dinner which was always wonderful. The food is absolutely amazing, so much choice on the menu with a good mix of Indonesian and western food. It is well priced and always beautifully presented. The staff are excellent and the owners of the hotel Gus and Sandy are wonderful hosts. Can recommend this place to anyone!
title: Beautiful food, wonderful staff!

text:
We stayed at Villa Agung  for two nights, and overall enjoyed the stay in a family room, one QS and two single beds.

The property is a little tired, not yet run down, but could do with a little attention.  The room was clean, bed comfortable, bathroom OK, and overall quite clean.  The pool is small, but it's right on the beach.

The included breakfast was good, and dinner at the restaurant enjoyable.

A negative for me was that it's several Kms from the action in Lovina, so transport is almost a must, but I read that the hotel does provide transport on request.

Gus, the American owner, is a decent guy, loves a chat about almost anything, including politics!!

I gave this 6/10 using my own points system, but I don't think that's entirely accurate, and can be a bit cruel, so an 'overall impressions' score of about 8/10 would be more realistic.  scoring location is difficult.  It gets 10 for being on the beach, but only 4 for the distance from the main part of Lovina.

I'd recommend it, but suggest that having your own transport, whilst not absolutely necessary, would be beneficial.
title: Worth a visit.

text: Lovina Beach is a place worth staying for more days. Villa Agung Beach Inn is a good hotel when you stay in Lovina. Although my wife and I only stayed here only for one night, we  were impressed by the well designed and cleaned room.  The  staffs in the hotel are so helpful especially the gardener. Mr Gus,the boss of the villa, is a very good man,who help us to much. Thank you very much. I think we will definitely  choose this hotel again when we back to Lovina.
title: A very good hotel to stay in lovina

text: After the hustle and bustle of legian villa agung is a piece of paradise.   Set about 3km out if lovina main it is situated on the beach and is a gorgeous getaway where you really unwind.  Gus and Sandy welcomed us like we were family.   Nothing was too much trouble and their hospitality is what makes this place great.  We booked the villa room which is awesome for a 3star so spacious.   All the rooms have a king bed and bunks which is perfect for a family.   We were surprised that there is no tv but realused pretty quickly with a lounge placed on the 2nd floor above the restaurant we had our own natural tv :-).  The rooms are clean and serviced daily.   Overall the staff, the owners, location and rooms suited us perfectly.   I finally feel like Ihave had a break and am relaxed.  Thank you Gus, Sandy and staff ffor a great break.  Molly,  nick and I appreciate you having us at the Villa
title: Never want to leave

text: My wife and I had a great stay at Villa Agung.  What an incredible value - the rooms and inn are tastefully decorated in Balinese art, the beds comfortable and being right on the water in a quiet location was wonderful.  Its so fun and relaxing to be able to sit right down by the water with your morning sunrise coffee, or sunset Bintang, the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly, especially Nyoman who is just awesome and the food is excellent.  People were coming to Villa Agung for their meals from all of the other hotels in the area. Hats off to Gus and Sandy for having such a wonderful place, we hope to return someday!
title: great stay, wish it had been longer

text:
we had our second stay at the delightful Villa Agung in late May/early June, for 11 nights. Since our first visit the previous year, our room had been given a lovely facelift. We had a new mattress, very firm and ultra comfortable, there were new curtains, a new bedhead, new bed cover and masses of cushions which I utilised when relaxing on the outside lounge and reading. Bed linen was of an extrememly high standard, crisp and snowy white. Shower towels were also new, very white and of a generous size.

Breakfast is included in the room rate, and consists of fruit or juice and a hot dish cooked to order, plus some wonderful home made breads and home made jam. The breads are yummy!

The restaurant at this hotel is amazing. So good, we never felt the need to eat elsewhere, and menu prices are tax included and very reasonable. The chicken with cranberries is to die for, and the many fish meals which I ate were always wonderful, with the fish moist and tender. 

The hotel is situated in a small fishing village, a few klm to the east of Lovina, but it is easy to walk up to the main road and catch a bemo into Lovina or Singaraja, or you can arrange to be driven there for a modest cost. The hotel is generally very quiet and absolute waterfront. It it a place to unwind and relax. Massages can be enjoyed in the area above the restaurant while listening to the ocean gently lap the shoreline...what a paradise!

Host Gus is so very helpful and we always enjoy his company. He goes out of his way to look after every person staying at the hotel. All the staff are great, it's like a big happy family. Gus's wife Sandy has been away on both of our stays, but we look forward to meeting her on our next visit, which is already booked.

I noted an earlier review which said the pool is not maintained - I did not find this to be correct as I noticed staff member Nyoman cleaning the pool daily and checking water quality with a test kit. It was alway done quite early in the morning, so perhaps the previous reviewer was still in the room.

Our stay at Villa Agung was so enjoyable that we've already booked to return. Many thanks Gus and staff for making our time with you so enjoyable. We look forward to seeing you again soon, and to meeting Sandy.
title: we just want to keep coming back

text: Lovina Beach is a place worth staying for more days. Villa Agung Beach Inn will be a good place when you go to Lovina. Although my wife and I only stayed here for one day to see dolphin, we stilled were impressed by the room decoration and staffs' good service. We are not native english speaker, we may met with difficulties when communicating with hotel staffs. But their warming attitude made us feel like staying at home. I think we definitely will choose this hotel again when we return Lovina.
title: Nice place to stay over one night

text: A friend and I happened upon this place as a spot to rest a d recuperate after a few days of climbing volcanos in eastern Java. What a delightful place. Our family sized room was large and comfortable with a huge skylit bathroom with a rain shower. Their are a small number of rooms, so you get to know some of the other guest in the common areas quite quickly. One couple we met have been coming here every year or a decade - I can see why!
title: What a find!

text:
Villa Agung is a small accommodation located on the beach in the quiet part of Lovina. The rooms were nice and spacious and the food served at the restaurant was great. Walking from our room to the beach took only 30 seconds. The owner Gus is a very friendly man, eager to help or to chat!

Villa Agung has a small "pool" which is not maintained but then it's no problem when you have the sea/beach 30 seconds walk from the room.  :)
title: Small accommodation located on the beach

text:
Villa Agung is located on the beach in the quiet part of Lovina. This is a small hotel with only a few rooms and that was exactly what we were looking for. Walking from our room to the beach took only 30 seconds.. Perfect!
The owner Gus is a very friendly man who is always eager to help or to chat! The rooms were good and spacious! Villa Agung is the place for you if you like to relax in a small hotel and love to relax on the beach.
title: Small hotel located perfectly on the beach

text:
We spent 3 nights at Villa Agung Beach Inn end of March with my family and had a great experience. 
Leo, the driver, picked us up at the airport and we were welcome by the owner Gus even though it was past midnight. 
Staff very friendly, food very good and very good value. 
Family rooms spacious and clean
The pool is a bit small but the hotel is right on the beach and the water was very clean and quiet. 
Definitely want to go back there, nice place for a relaxing few days
title: Excellent choice

text: What a delightful little place.  We were walking past and decided that a drink would be nice and it was.  So nice in fact that we decided we would have lunch here.  The food was fresh and very quick to arrive.
