The atmosphere was very relaxing and I am sure that it would be a delightful place to stay and if we had not booked elsewhere we may have even gone here.  It will certainly be on our list when we come back.
title: Just called in for a drink & lunch

text:
What a nice place--Lovely hosts--Gus and Sandy
Not too large-which is nice -lay around the pool,small-but ok, the rooms currently being renovated--Ocean views-one of the best features of Villa Agung is the Restaraunt ,Amazing food serves by excellent attentive Balinese Staff---Highly recommend a stay
title: Enchanting

text: We loved the place, Gus and the crew. Food was good too. We did the dolphin tour and enjoyed the tour. If you ask from Gus(the owner) he will arrange for you. The tour is Rs 70.000, but the guy(Nyomen)  who works their for Gus took from us Rs 75,000, but Well worth it. If you want to go snorkeling just walk few meters to right a boat owner (his name is Bruno) will take you for Rs 75.000 Even the snorkeling if you ask  from Nyoman from hotel will tell higher price like Rs 90,000. I don't think the extra money goes the hotel but nyoman's pocket. Gus help us even to find a car to Kuta for Rs 45,000, The driver was very good. The drivers name is Leo. Gus and his wife trying the best for every guest and very friendly
title: Enjoyed the place

text:
This hotel is a real gem!
The owners are very friendly and helpful, they will help you to organise the best activities at the best price. We paid half the price of the agency in town when they helped us organise a diving excursion. The food is in my opinion the best in all of Lovina so no need to look for restaurants :) The location is beautifully set just at the beach and the shadowy garden is like a dream. Best value for money. Thank you Guss and Norman!!
title: Wonderful place!

text:
We spent 3 nights here from 26th December to 29th December and loved it!  We stayed room 4 in the corner,  the room is starting to show its age,  the water pressure is hopeless but the aircon works well, bed is comfy and the rooms are clean. 
The thing that makes this hotel is the fantastic personalised service from Gus, nyoman and all the staff.
The restaurant is fantastic, we ate every meal there except lunch on one day which we had while on a tour and I came down with terrible Bali belly! I now wish we didn't go on the tour and only ate at the hotel. Gus even bought green tea especially for me! 
We did a snorkelling tour of menjangan island, a driving tour of the north of Bali and organised a dolphin tour with nyoman. Unfortunately I was too ill to go on the dolphin tour so will have to do that again next time! We would definitely stay here again.

Thanks villa agung!
title: wonderful relaxing place to stay

text:
Booked a one night's stay here to go on the wild dolphin watch. Took the tour organised by the motel as the one booked by our driver was more expensive. It was so convenient as we had to wake up at the crack of dawn. Walked down the beach from the motel's restaurant to the beachside, a short stroll to the left and we were right by the boat that takes us for the tour.

We arrived after sunset; nearly missed the signboard to the motel. One side of the motel faces the paddy fields, while the restaurant faces the ocean front. Despite being right on the oceanfront the night was quite humid and you still need the air-conditioner and fan.

Though homey, the rooms are showing signs of wear and tear. The ceiling fan in our room is a bit noisy. Loved the Balinese design shower area.

We arrived just before 8pm, and was advised to go down to the restaurant as soon as possible if we want to have dinner as the kitchen was closing. The food was very good esp. the lime chicken set. Chose the pancake set for breakfast the next morning after the dolphin tour.

The owner was very friendly; the staff (if not mistaken his name is Nyoman) as well and also helpful (arranged the dolphin tour for us as well as gave us some useful tips).

It was very peaceful lying on the lounge chair with the seabreeze in your face and hearing the waves. Wished we had more time there just to laze around and explore more of Lovina.
title: NIce homely stay.. location!

text: Villa Agung at Anturan is my home away from home. It is my perfect peaceful getaway in Bali or anywhere else in the world for that matter. Absolute beachfront with snorkelling at the front door, swimming in clear water, and nearby fishing villages to explore.  Everything you need passes by on the beach - massage, clothes repair, manicure and relaxed shopping with wonderful local people. Take the time to get to know the locals here and you will be rewarded. Gus, Sandy and Nyoman are wonderful hosts, taking care of every need and offering the personal touch. The staff are relaxed and friendly and the rooms spotlessly clean. The restaurant on site provides excellent food all day and the guest lounge has views to die for. I felt very special in my Little Cottage and can't wait to return with my children.
title: Can't wait to return

photos.caption: My favourite spot sunrise and sunset

text: This is, in one wort,  our 10 days experience in this fine inn. What a place to be. After the hectic of Surabaya and Malang we (sometimes just the two of us sometimes with 15 other family between 2 and 82 yeas old) hat a great time at Villas Agung. Not only the beautiful environment but most certainly the unbelievable hospitality and service. The staff and the hosts Gus and Sandy made us feel God in Bali. The food the sunrise and sunsets do make you feel ever so happy. Thank you so much and we will be back soon.
title: Unforgettable

photos.caption: Relaxing 4 meters above the beach, watching the see. Sometimes after a great massage.
That close you are to the see

text:
This is a must stay!  I was fortunate to be travelling by myself and stayed in the "little cottage"'. After the hustle and bustle of Bali's south, I was only 10m from the beach. Each night falling asleep to the sound of the water. Sunsets are marvellous with a hush and calm that descends on the place as all take in the sunsets (and cocktails). As part of the stay the hosts (Sandy and Gus) took me on a trip around Lovina where I met the staff's family compound, shops and the Lovina area. It is not your regular organised tour but a more personal version - so much better than the standard tours offered elsewhere. Staff at the villa can provide assistance and book tours which saves a heap of time and confusion you will experience in town from the competing hawkers. 

Sandy and Gus were wonderful hosts and I look forward to returning and sharing the experience of their company and Lovina with my husband and son's.
title: A piece of heaven

photos.caption: Discreet entrance to Villa Agung Beach Inn
Little Cottage, Villa Agung Beach Inn

text: Bit late writing this, had another wonderful few days at villa agung, the owners gus and sandy were more than happy to let me bring 56 children from an orphanage in singaraja to the hotel, the children came in 3 "shifts", they swam, buried themselves in sand, dug holes looking for creatures, only the boys did that. Then the kids had a nice lunch in villa agung's lovely little beachside restaurant before going home, most of them to sleep, ha ha I love it when I exhaust them as they exhaust me, but what a wonderful exhaustion it is, I highly recommend a trip to an orphanage if u can, it's actually a very uplifting experience, if u stay somewhere like villa agung u could take a couple of kids to the beach for an hour or two, I took them all because villa agung made it easy for me and I've known these kids a long time now, I felt guilty about the kids that-hadn't been to the Beach or on an outing yet so I just took all the kids that day that were there, some were not,there's 88 kids in total at the dana punia orphanage and its one of the few honest ones, didn't mean to babble about kids so much but they are beautiful and if u love bali then helping the kids is a nice way to give something back, thanks gus and sandy  the kids have a fantastic day, everyone did, have to tell u a huge storm hit just after the last kids left, perfect timing, I love a good storm and did some rain baking on a sun bed by the Beach, loved it.
title: Can't wait for my next visit

text: I didn't stay here, unfortunately I stayed next door at the Bali Grand Sunset. I had the worst experience and the staff at Villa Agung Beach Inn, tried the whole time to make it up to me. So lovely, and such a lovely place and a peaceful atmosphere and energy. I looked at the rooms, all nice, and good for $$. the couryard is lovely and so is the deck upstairs
title: Stay here

text:
We stayed two nights at Villa Agung. Although the surroundings are lovely (courtyard, beach front....)  we didn't really like the atmosphere. It's relaxing and the kids loved the beach but eveytime we asked something about transportion for instance it was difficult, would cost a lot of money and so on...They overcharge for the dolphin watching tour so don't book via the hotel.

Rooms are dated. I wanted a hotel with a Balinese outdoor bathroom and got it here but let us say that will be a once in a lifetime experience. 
The pool is small but sufficient. A bit more sunbeds by the sea would be nice.

Villa Agung is in the middle of nowhere. You can take a bemo to Lovina centre (which is very small) or just stay at the beach. All day long you have people that try to sell you things. After a couple of no's they leave you alone (well, almost).

The restaurant is surprisingly good. We ate one night at the hotel and one night next door. Don't go there, it was awful. We had to send our dinner back three times. But the food at Villa Agung is nice. Breakfast is à la carte and on the small side.
title: Relaxing

owner_response.text: The hotel does not receive any funds from the dolphin boats or drivers, tours etc.  These are all independent contractors who have their own negotiation terms with the locals.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This place is perfect to just relax and is a great price.  I stayed with two of my friends and although it wasn't a resort, it had character and a personal feel during the entire stay.  The owners, Sandy and Gus, were great hosts and even drove us into the village a few times.  The staff was amazing. Just as an example, we bought strawberries one day and asked if they could wash them.  The staff ended up washing them, cutting them and serving them on a plate for us.  And they even opened up breakfast a half hour early when we had to meet early for the tour  The food was delicious.  The villa is right on the beach which has amazing sunsets to watch. Just a note, the room that we had the bathroom was kinda of outside (had walls but there was a space in between the walls and the roof). We weren't expecting it and there was a few bugs because of it.  But overall our stay was exciting and relaxing.  I will definitely go back if I ever go back to Bali.
title: Perfect Place to relax

text:
What to say!! Great food, ballinese as well as western dishes...simple and tasty. Greek salad !! perfect after many rice dishes!! Accommodation simple but all that is needed. Clean bathroom, clean beds,  fans that work and balcony over the pool area. really lovely.
Had yoga upstairs above the restaurant - ideal to look out at the sea, stretch and relax! perfect.
Owners very friendly but not in your face or pushy. 
Not plush but we'd come back very happily!
title: Loved our time here

text: Stayed one night with kids. This is a slightly aging hotel (although recently renovated) with somewhat threadbare bedding but the rooms are clean, there's a fan and A/C, and a fridge with very well priced beverages. There's a small pool, but our kids skipped it to spend almost all of this time on the beach (which is directly in front of the lounge chairs and restaurant, and so is fantastic for parents of kids you want to keep an eye on). Gus and Sandy were extremely friendly and helpful, as was Neuman the chief of staff (?).
title: Modest and aging, but decent rooms and great beachside stay for those with kids

text: Stayed here for 2 nights.  Good location, good service, clean, unique bathroom.  Really worth it.  Will I come back here if I visit Lovina again?  Of course!  The beach in front of the hotel is clean.  However, to the sides of the beach, there are local villages, and the beach itself is a bit dirty.  Basic amenities are in here, the only thing missing is TV, shampoo and safe deposit box (I don't need them).  They'll arrange for you if you are interested for snorkeling and dolphin watch.
title: Nice Location

text: It was a nice surprise to find a place actually living up to the photos you see posted on the internet when booking. Even though I only spent one night at Lovina I can definitely say this hotel is a lovely place where I will stay again when I come back to Bali to experience the north and west of the island. Right at the beach, quiet (except for the waves that is), clean, very friendly and attentive staff, and all for a very reasonable price. When I wanted to pay for the room in the morning and didn't have enough money (they don't take cards)  they put their trust in me and let me drive off in search for an ATM with the promise to come back with more cash. Thanks for a good nights rest in a comfy bed.
title: Nice Surprise

text: Everytime we go to Lovina, we always stay here. The room was not too small, was clean, and the shower was good. It has a small garden and a restaurant facing the beach. We went here once for Nyepi, and we had a good quiet experience. The staff were helpful and friendly. The restaurant has nice drinks menu. The location is not far from the town but hidden in a serene area. It's perfect place to stay!
title: Clean and beautiful

text:
Yes ,the villa agung is too nice for me and I will stay there again if come back to Lovina,without hesitation.

The room is so beautiful and so Bali,I will never forget the pebbles and the stone statue of Buddha in the bathroom.I like the design,connect eveyroom with a long veranda and a chair there ,we close to our friends,just like the dream house in my childhood.

The pool is more like a garden view ,with the blooming frangipani and the Bali style bale.

Our second floor's room though a platform get the public veranda with leisure.So amazing!A wooden house facing to the sea.Very comfortable palce.There are so many books and wonden chairs,a great place for lounging,reading ,resting,singing,relaxing,even for videotel with your family.The wifi is pretty well.

I feel stay the wooden veranda holds the whole Lovina.I need't go out at all.Smiling girls took their special pancakes and  fruit boats for us.

The house is simple and cheap,but we experience our most happy hours there .
title: Really comfortable for lounging,we love it.

text:
Villa Agung serves wonderful food and drinks, so you could easily just spend your days lounging in the breezy upstairs veranda, reading, resting or getting bodywork.  The pool is small but clean and nice for a dip. If you're up for a little adventure, take the morning dolphin watch boat or make your way into town to walk around.

There was not reliable wi-fi when we were there, so we found a restaurant in town that had it, and where we felt welcome to have an extended lunch while checking our mail, etc.

We rented a scooter, which made the trip into town simple.  The hosts will be glad to help you obtain a scooter, or get a shuttle ride, or even drive you themselves!
title: Great for relaxing, doing nothing in particular

photos.caption: View from the veranda at Villa Agung.

text:
Hubby & I have just spent a week at the lovely Villa Agung. Everything about our stay was positive. The rooms are spacious, clean and have good sized bathrooms with plenty of hot water.There is a very informative booklet in the room suggesting things to do and see in the area. Host Gus is great, friendly, helpful and a lot of fun to sit and chat with. Then there is the food......there is an extensive menu, and meals we ate were always of excellent quality and at a very affordable price, in fact it was so good, that we never ate anywhere else. The cap cay was the best I have ever eaten.

This budget hotel is very suitable for those wishing to stay somewhere quiet, yet in the most beautiful of surroundings, as it is right on the beachfront.
title: a wonderful experience

text:
love this place! Just back from Bali and Lovina is a place I'd definitely stay longer next time. Villa Agung is this adorable little hotel just on the beach side, 2 min walk to the street and about 5 min drive from the town makes it a very quiet place to stay. 

Only a few rooms available and the downstairs rooms have this view right through the dining area to the sea. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Bathroom's quite unique with all the decorations. On arrival it's rainning heavily and the place seemed quite damp to me but on the next day when sun started to shine the garden looks adorable.

And the food. Thought of going to the main street to dine and after having dinner here decided to stay and enjoy the food from the kitchen. The food is delicious.
title: totally adorable with sea view

photos.caption: dining area just on the beach

text: This was a wonderful, relaxed interlude in our travels. The guest house is close enough to Lovina for some shopping, if needed, but far enough away to be able to experience the peace and calm craved by people wanting to "get away from it all". I cannot bring to my mind any similar stay that I've had, where the hosts were so willing to give the time to share all their local knowledge and advice, and even took one of our party on a tour of town!  The wide variety of food on offer in the restaurant was tasty, delightfully prepared. Definitely a place on my 'would like to return to' list.
title: Totally relaxed

text:
Emailed few months earlier and promptly replied by Gus.  Due to itinerary changes, I decided to travel to Lovina on my arrival date and Sandy allowed reservation on check in day by phone call.  Thanks Sandy.

Room no 3 located on top floor with view to the garden, pool and partial view of the sea blocked by library roof top.  From front door, the view of main road and padi plantation.  Very spacious room area with shower, small fridge, cupboard and tea making facilities but without TV.  Friendly staffs.
title: Villa Agung 26/3/12

photos.caption: villa agung room view from library

text: Stayed for 3 nights but definitly could of stayed longer.  Right on the beach so great views. Food was really good and Gus and Sandy the owners went out of the way to help and make your stay enjoyable. Loved the township of Lovina, plenty to do and lots of markets.  I also enjoyed the upstairs library and games room.
title: Thoroughly enjoyable

text: We arrived here after two weeks on Java and it was a very warm welcome. Very nice hosts, quiet place, perfect if you want some peace and quiet. BIG PLUS is the excellent food!
title: perfect place to relax

text:
I stayed here for 5 nights on my first solo trip........ I just love this place!!! Fantastic smiling and helpful staff, great friendly owners and lovely accommodations.
I just love the upstairs library on the beach and spent many hours here reading and relaxing.
The restaurant is very good with a great, varied menu and the girls in the kitchen are fantastic cooks.  I ate all but 3 of my meals here.
This is a great value for money hotel and I will be back to stay again in April 2012 with my partner as part of my "Big 5 0" birthday trip :)
title: Perfect relaxing spot

text: My family spent a very relaxing couple of days in Lovina.  Villa Agung felt like a home away from home, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the owners couldn't do enough for us.  Restaurant was wonderful, some of the best food we had in Bali.
title: relaxing accommodation not in central lovina

text:
This place is our favourite place in Bali...Villa Agung and it's location.
Just 6 rooms and 1 villa and we have stayed in the double room upstairs with extra matress, the family room downstairs with king bed and bunks and the villa this trip with sofa style bed that you pull out and turn around....and bunks.
The Villa has table and chairs and a plasma tv. We chose this as we were there for 10 nights (not long enough for us) but the family room was just as lovely.(no tv).
The hotel has security. They are so attentive that if I were still sitting out at night, they bought me over a mozzie pot.
The staff in the kitchen (that also clean the rooms, about 9 girls) are just gorgeous.
They are the best cooks.....especially Ani. Sandy gives them recipes and goes over them with them and wow can they cook.
I am sure Sandy was a master chef in a past life, she knows her food.
They all love and look up to Gus too and it's lovely hearing his cheery voice in the morning.
The Pool is small, but so is the hotel. It's just lovely being in it cooling off and gazing up to all the frangipanis. One day I gathered them all up and sat them on the side of the pool and took photos.....just gorgeous.
Gus has a kayak that he cant manage anymore...but husband and daughter took that out in the shallows and thoroughly enjoyed.
Daughter went snorkling for the first time with a fellow guest and once you get past the first section of the water....she said it was quite clean and she found plenty of blue star fish to look at.
This hotel is not posh or pretencious......it is comfortable and homely and the decor is very lovely.
We got a lift in to Lovina with Gus and Sandy and caught a bemo back
We got a lift into Singaraja once.
We also had our driver Leo take us to the foundation in the village that we sponsor with.
He also took us on a half day trip to the hot springs and the Buddhist temple.
Apart from that, we never wanted to leave the hotel......in 10 days.
We thoroughly enjoyed reading, swimming, beach walks in both directions and daily massages with the 2 Mades and Wayan.
They were so appreciative of our daily business, they gave us fruit.
We also enjoyed a bit of beach shopping.....because it's easy. Sarongs, carving, jewellery, ikat throw rug, table runner, pashmina and we even bought Kebayers.
We loved catching Gus and Sandy at the beach bar about 5pm each night for a drink.
This is my third review, so I will leave it at that....but I will add that I cant wait to get back.
Villa agung....you rock !
title: Our very favourite hotel

photos.caption: main bed..pull out and turn around for bed

text: Villa agung is 2 bemo stations from lovina (5000 rph/ pers) but has a good location if you're looking for something quiet and it' s right on the beach. the rooms are average but the bathroom was renovated and looks good. Mt Agung it can be seen from the balcony and looks breathtaking. we stayed here just 1 night but it was ok.
title: Away from lovina but good location right on the beach

text: Very suitable for travellers looking for cozy and homy stay in Lovina, Bali. The location is a bit far from crowds, good for meditation. Helpful Nyoman, head of villa, and timely strict owner Gus, but overall nice hiding place. I stayed with my family for 5 nights, the kods are happy, playing sand on the beach of its backyard.
title: Friendly and homy, cozy and quiet with beach backyard - Bersahabat dan seperti rumah sendiri, nyaman dan tenang dengan pantai di

text: Stayed for a few nights on a trip round the whole island. Run by westerners you felt there was a personal touch at this guest house. Sun sets were beautiful and good location for dolphin trips as they leave from the beach In front of the property. Not much else going on in the area itself so don't arrive with great expectations. Food offered here was fresh but not always great. Rooms are spacious but dated. Needs some modernisation . Very homely place where you can relax and get good advice from the owners. Will not be everyones cup of tea- lovina itself as a location has little to offer but we used it as a base to explore in land and mountain regions. The amount of rubbish in the sea and on beaches depressed me to say the least when at home one tries hard to recycle and conserve. Seeing locals chucking out bags of plastic and rubbish on mountain roads shocked me!
title: Decent place on a good stretch if beach.

text:
After finding Villa Agung on tripadvisor we drove down there and met manager Gus.He showed us around Lovina. The tips from Villa Agung in the books in the rooms where amazing. The dolphins,  the snorkeling trips, the massage salon. And the food is amazing too. Sometimes people from other hotels come eating at Villa Agung.

A really nice place, especially considering the price. We loved it. If we ever comeback we would definitely return here if we return to Bali.

Thanks to Gus and the staff for the wonderful time!
title: Really nice time

text:
I didn't stay at Villa Agung but the restaurant is a standout.

It has a wide range of dishes but best of all they serve Balinese food as well. The chef/s are wonderful, the kitchen in view and spotless, the service fast.

I ate here most lunches and all dinners for 5 days and never finished the vegetarian dishes, each one uniquely tasty, let alone start on the the other sections of the menu.
title: The restaurant is great!!!

text:
When friends asked me to come along on their return trip to Villa Agung on Bali, I had little to go on from their description - I believe the term 'a few nice huts, very close to the beach' was mentioned. So it was quite the surprise to discover the place actually is a wonderful small hotel (maximum capacity about 40 guests), situated around a central courtyard and in pristine condition. Said court contains a small pool and beautifully maintained garden, which contribute to a sense of serenity one but rarely experiences. Surrounding the yard on two sides are the rooms, two storeys of them at this time (the Villa recently expanded a little, while staying true to its modest character). The - very affordable - rooms are not overly luxurious, but do come equipped with all amenities needed, and sufficient space not to feel crowded - I have stayed in far more expensive places which were a lot less comfortable, to be sure. The bathrooms are particularly nice, being semi-open (while of course providing all the privacy one would expect). One word of warning: the lay-out of the ground-floor rooms at least is not ideal if you expect perfect privacy, more suited to a family than a group of friends perhaps. If you need more space, just book two rooms.
Overlooking the sea, at most ten yards from the ocean's edge, you will find a lovely dining area in early 20th century style, with deck chairs providing a wonderful spot for sunbathing and enjoying the view of the ocean. An extra sun deck was recently added above this area, where one can read from the small library while sitting in comfortable wicker chairs, again with the amazing view of the ocean. The setting sun is a daily delight and delivers a gorgeous backdrop during breakfast, lunch and dinner. 
The hotel's kitchen offers a very extensive menu of extremely well-prepared dishes, both Indonesian, Balinese and European for those who would prefer a meal to remind them of their home country. However, even though the highly capable kitchen staff assuredly can provide (for example) an excellent burger and chips or shepherd´s pie, one definitely should try the local dishes, which are truly excellent. Having sampled the wonderful food at local markets, I can attest the dishes from the hotel kitchen are at least as good, while still amazingly affordable. The staff is friendly and polite to a fault, from immensely capable chef Annie to affable groundskeeper Norman: always ready to fulfill whatever request a guest might have, delivering unobtrusive and speedy service with a smile. Special mention should be made of the proprietor, who during our stay proved himself to be the perfect host, paying great attention to the well-being and comfort of his guests, always aware and on the look-out to ensure no need goes unanswered. He is a veritable fount of interesting facts about the island and useful information on sights to see during one's stay, as well as of ways to make the already great experience this island and hotel provide even better. At the risk of sounding gushing, I´ve not experienced this kind of service in European hotels six or seven times as expensive. Some people may need a moment to adjust to the local townspeople who come by the beach with various wares, but really these folks provide a useful service: you can pick up various locally crafted goods to take home (presents!), while supporting the local economy. This way, rather than scheduling extra time for shopping, you can spend your time seeing the many worthwhile sights on the island, from the holy hot springs to the crafting districts of Ubud to the south. Truly there is very little left to wish for here, except perhaps more time for a longer stay - which is why, like my accompanying friends, I will surely return here as well.
title: Most relaxing holiday destination ever!

photos.caption: Sunset view from the dining area, backdrop to every dinner.
Villa Agung dining area with view of the ocean.
Villa Agung courtyard with pool and garden

text: We very much enjoyed the location of this resort. On arrival, we had lunch and Bintang. One must learn to say Saya Suda Puniya or Tiduk due to the persistence of local hawkers. That aside, everything else was fantastic. Lovina Beach has a calm atmosphere and warm sea for swimming. 20,000 Rp for a 2-3 hour sail on a local fishing catamaran is a must. You get to talk with a local fisherman and learn how friendly they are. A quick Bemo to town for a vast variety of shops, bars and health spas. The local driver is Inyoman (I nicknamed him  Gelar Inyoman) and he is very nice and very funny. Gus runs this villa and is the perfect gentleman. Full recommendation for anyone wanting cheap rates and a great location. Oh! The cocktails are second to none too!
title: A place to truly relax in an easy way in a great location

text:
We arrived with a sick 2yo in the late afternoon. We had discussions with the owners and by 10am the following morning they had taken us to a doctor, sat in as an interpreter, and taken us to a dispensary. The service of Gus and Sandy I could not find fault with. 
Being the parents mentioned in the previous post - I would like to point out she was sick. And we were doing the very best we could. I wonder if Noah was ever sick at the age of 2?? 
The upstairs reading area was excellent. The children could play and we could hear what they were up to. The pool was excellent - small, but very sufficient. To have a massage upstairs was wonderful. The food was lovely - and hot. We did not eat anywhere else. After swimming in the pool and beach for the afternoon we would shower and start the night at the bar on the beach watching the sunrise - bliss! We stayed for 6 nights and I think I ate my way through the menu. The Indonesian dishes were lovely, as were the Western. The staff were very accommodating with making up meals for the children - as in nuggets and vegetables, instead of chips. Or simply a plate of vegetables. My favorites - cap cay and black rice pudding. My husband loved the steak shallots. 
Just up the beach is a little strip of shops which are great for icecreams. The vendors can be overwhelming, but know your prices and stick to them. We went dolphin spotting at 5.30am - which was an amazing sunrise and lovely. 
The staff were absolutely lovely. Very polite - but very friendly and easygoing. Their knowledge of the local area was wonderful and they would happily discuss a number of options with us. The in-room compendiums were a gem of knowledge. 
And yes - we were invited to check out Sandy's dogs too and found that quite interesting.
There is a new villa almost complete that looks wonderful.  
Gus and Sandy were wonderful hosts. We very much enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it for the future.
title: A wonderful place, wonderful staff and wonderful hosts

text:
My wife and I stayed here three years ago for two weeks so we were eager to see how the place looked after renovations.  Villa Agung is, we are glad to say, still a wonderfully private spot to spend some time.  The formerly horrendous beds have been spiffed up with new and comfortable mattresses. Every room now has air conditioning and a refrigerator.  The bathrooms have new showers and all of the curtains and decorations have been made new.

We were eager to show the place to our friends from England and we were all planning a 7 day stay.  Unfortunately there was a rude family staying downstairs while we were there.  One of the daughters was given to long loud tantrums which her parents seemed unable or unwilling to exert control over.  After being roused from bed at 5 AM on the 2nd day (an improvement as the little tyke had woken us up at 1 AM the night before) I asked the night manager 'Norman' if he could do anything about the problem.  He ran downstairs and returned with a pot of steaming Lombok coffee.  I assumed that the caffeine was an attempt on his part to relieve me of my need for sleep.  I asked him if he could ask the family to turn down the volume on the kid but he didn't think the wailing a problem.

The restaurant's food is good and competitively priced.  The only problem we ran into was the chef's inability to serve eggs at a temperature above lukewarm.  After the third occurrence we brought the issue to the attention of 'Sandy' the owner.  She agreed that the eggs were cold but instead of remaking the eggs she reduced our bill breakfast by 50%.  A somewhat nonsensical response given that the eggs were included in the price of the room. I will add that Gus was kind enough during our stay to augment our inclusive morning meals with fresh melon.  Gus was the most responsive person we met at Villa Agung with regards to requests for assistance. 

Our room rate was 275,000 Rp per night without A/C.  With A/C the rate is 350,000 Rp per night.  A substantial increase above our November 2008 rate of 120,000 Rp per night without A/C.  Sandy, the owner, took issue with my memory of the room rate but I looked through my records (I'm a travel writer and keep exhaustive files on these matters) and quickly located the original room quote e-mail that was provided to me by her partner 'Gus' in September of 2008.  I would be happy to forward a copy of the same to any interested parties. Also note that while the hotel's website quotes rates in US dollars; the hotel staff quotes all prices in Rupiah.

Villa Agung is a beautiful little spot and had we not run into the noise issue we would have been happy to extend our stay.  A more empathetic manager would have gone a long way to solving this problem.
title: A Mixed Bag

text:
This is about our 4th stay in Lovina and we have now decided that it is the place we love most in Bali and the place that we want to spend the most time in.
The main reason we have decided this is because of Villa Agung.
The other reason is the surrounds of Villa Agung including the beach people that live there in the fishing village.
I am going to talk about our stay there and not just Villa Agung, as the whole thing needs to be read in order to understand why Lovina and Villa Agung is so special.
Many people find Lovina boring....look deeper and you will see otherwise.
Arriving at Villa Agung (with our wonderful Lovina driver Leo, who also sells pearls on the beach)), we pulled up and walked in and said…ok we are home.
Seeing Gus and Sandy again was great, Gus is American and Sandy English and so you just know if there are any problems, they will understand and help.
Being somewhere reasonably remote…..gives you a good feeling that there are westerners there if you need them.
We unpacked for our 4 night stay (should have been much longer and will be next time) and the rooms have been renovated.
Beautifully decorated, light and bright and cheerful.
Locked cupboard for your valuables.
Tea and coffee.
Fridge full of goodies cheap enough to consume.
Small pool that is a big enough size for the small hotel (6 rooms, 2 villas)
Breakfast that is adequate (eggs, toast, juice etc)
Wonderful food served at the restaurant and we ate there every night.
A commpendium full of information on Lovina and Singaraja and the hotel. (we ventured to Singaraja for a salon hair wash and shopping in hardies).
Fan and air con. The air con isn’t enough for me, they are a little older….so I have the fan on too. But to be fair, my husband reckons I make him get iceycles on his eyebrows, so that’s just me needing both.
No tv, so we use this time at night to read…. which we really should do more of.
There is a beautiful villa there just about completed and for those inclined, it houses a plasma tv.
We chose the family room downstairs in front of the pool, which has a king bed and a divider wall that is home to a set of bunks on the other side. They have an outdoor bathroom with the most equisite shower that you will ever see. (I want one at home :)
After unpacking, we waked out and saw the kitchen staff and it felt like we had walked into a rellies house.
I then stepped out onto the beach to take in the ocean views and was there only a few minutes....I had just stepped back to the pool area when I heard my massage lady Made come screeching in yelling my name.
Huge hugs later, I asked how she knew I was there and she told me she had seen me from her house around the bay on the beach.
We then saw the other pearl seller Tony. Hallo Hallo.
The other ladies arrived in dribs and drabs…hallo hallo.
This area is a little fishing village, home to wonderful people and we are lucky enough to be staying in the middle of it.
The beach people were still on to sell us stuff and give massages, don’t get me wrong….but Lovina is quiet and we were the only ones booked into our wonderful hotel, had it to ourselves for 4 nights….so business is slow and they are desperate for sales. 
Besides which, how good is it to be able to enjoy a daily massage upstairs in the library room every day for 50 000rp whilst listening to the ocean.
Being a bit of a shopper, i find the ease of buying on the beach really nice too, scarves, sarongs (for table cloths too), necklaces, pearls etc. 
They chatted to us each day and during our morning and afternoon beach strolls, they invited us into their homes. 
During these walks, we would see pigs and piglets, hens and their babies, squid just having been caught for dinner, fishing nets drying, little and big crabs, kids playing and it was a little village we felt completely at peace and far away from anything in.
Walking to the right of our hotel along the beach was quietest with beach shacks and a larger hotel (no thanks).
Walking to the left was warungs and hives of local activities and a larger hotel (no thanks).
You had to cross a little strung up bridge to get over one section of water, that we were lucky enough to see a large crab in.
We would sit at our hotel and listen to the fisherman in their boats at night talking to each other….Letting each other know where the fish were.
We couldn’t see them, we just saw their lights in the pitch black.
One night we watched one come in…so we thought we would walk up the beach to view their catch.
My husband asked the villa agung staff for a torch….but to everyones amusement, they gave him a mop LOL.
Once we got a torch, off we went.
One morning Gus and Sandy dropped us at Lovina town near the statue so we could check emails and browse the shops. We caught a bemo back (5000 each).
Before our massage, we went with Sandy and Gus to do the dog feed.
They rescue Bali dogs.
They have them vaccinated, feed them up and care for them and find them homes.
They are using an old school to house them and go there to clean it and feed them twice a day.
I must admit I was a bit frightened as I am of Bali dogs…..but Sandy is like a dog whisperer and they adore her.
She has rescued them dying after being dumped into holes etc and they love her.
She has one of her own called Pretty (staff named her).
We gave a little bit of money for dog biscuits. (they mix them with rice). Such a good cause.
Well our last day was a special ceremony for that area and so the staff were not going to be there for breakfast….so they put it all in our fridge the night before, before they went home. Fruit was nice, but we giggled to see they had made toast and then put it in the fridge haha. It was food and so it was ok LOL. How good was it, that they had not neglected us.
The next morning, we saw them all on the beach in their ceremonial dress and we could hear chanting in the distance.
Before we left at 9am, some staff in their dress with their families, came to the hotel to do offerings. It was very special to see.
Villa Agung and the surrounding area, is where we have decided we want to be and will spend the majority of our holidays there in the future.
It is a lovely hotel with very attentive owners and staff.
title: Our very favourite place in Bali

text: What i am about to say is the truth and nothing but the truth!!!!! Take NO notice of that bad review, this place is a little piece of paradise, great food at good prices, the staff bent over backwards to see to our every whim, this lovely man kept popping up out of the blue with beach towels, to light my cig's, to puff my pillow in the lounge or just to see if i wanted anything, so you can truly relax, in the rooms you have hot water, aircon or fan, coffee and tea facilities, mozzie nets and the rooms are clean and comfy, they even have a safe, it was wonderful to sit out the front of our rooms and still have ocean views. i slept like a baby with the sound of the ocean lulling me to sleep, you can't get closer to the beach than this, beautiful !!, hawkers are not a problem and a wonderful massage lady!!! the restaurant is ocean front, upstairs is a lounging room which overlooks the sea, television and DVD if you want it, even a library and massage bed,beautiful to sit and watch the sunset and the lights from the fishing boats at night. the lounge chairs are comfy and even have foot rest's, sunbeds are at the beach front and you can have shade if you want it, the pool is small but lovely, it is crystal clear clean water except in a storm and that's not the owners fault, they can't control the weather !! and if you love collecting shells as i do the beach out the front is shell heaven, beautiful tiny little shells and some not so little, if you clean out the sand and dry the shells customs let you keep them, the beach out the front is the cleanest beach i have been to in lovina, the water is clean too so nice for swimming in the ocean, the location of villa agung is perfect,all this at such a cheap price, i love this place. if you want to chill out it is the place to do it, super relaxing, i felt totally at home in this beautiful piece of paradise, i wanted to keep it to myself but after reading that bad review i had no choice but to let you all know the real villa agung and share it with you, we had 3 days there early feb and we go back for 5 days in march, i can't wait to get "home" again to my villa agung. if you don't love this place too then your to hard to please.
title: absolutely beautiful place to stay, loved it.

text:
This was our third trip to Lovina but the first to Villa Agung.
It is a little 6 room hotel right on the beach.
Pool is small, but it is only a 6 room hotel.
I would not swim in any beach in Bali, including Lovina. There were Europeans swimming there each morning though.
The sand is black (volcanic) with tiny little black crabs running down their little holes, won't come near you and interesting to watch.
Old ladies in the water collecting pebbles to sell to mainly hotels.
Fisherman in the water and in boats.
Looking accross to Java and in the other direction, to the mountains.
Serene and peaceful.
Library upstairs where we enjoyed our morning coffees looking out over the ocean.
We were bombarded with sellers (as you are anywhere on any beach in Bali) , but when we got chatting to them, they were lovely people. They also were allowed into the hotel on the Bale to give us massage, 50 000rp, same price as Kuta and we were happy.
As I was so relaxed and for the first time didn't feel at all inclined to go into the town of Lovina.....this actually gave me the opportunity to shop (being a self confessed shopaholic LOL).
I purchased some beautiful pearls and a sarong and 2 scarves. All Quite different from down south.
My daughter purchased a wooden carved box for her boyfriend and some necklaces that showed the story of Bali (made from coconut and shell and showed rice grains etc).
I am sure if you did not want to chat to these sellers though, that Sandy and Gus would ask them to leave you be. But once we bought, they became friends and waved to us and yelled hello and they were really lovely.

The drinks at the hotel were cheap, 25 000 for a gin and tonic.
The food was very well priced and we ate there both nights, something we very rarely do at a hotel. Food was outstanding.
Breakfast was so nice, watermelon with fresh coconut and drizzled with something....when we enquired it was tamarillo syrup. I so desperately wanted a bottle, but could not find and the one place that did have it down south, we were not going back to.
Also got toast, but it was not just normal toast, it was also a scone toast and like a fruit toast too. All home made by the looks and scrumptous. Most filling.

The rooms, well we had a double room upstairs with a spare mattress for our daughter.
It was on the floor, as are many in Bali. No problems. if we were there for a week, I would take the family room that had a double and 2 single beds in it.
The air con didn't work as well as the one in Kuta, but you didn't need it to work as well in Lovina. And you also had a ceiling fan, so i just had both going.
we had a fridge. Also tea and coffee, which was nice bonus for budget hotel.
And remember, this is budget, it is not 5 star, so don't expect it.
No television, but we only watch it for the news and how much of that will you get in Bali.
The bathroom was very spacious, although my one complaint was that the water pressure was not too good.
To wash your hair, just find a salon somewhere, no problems.
Loads of shelf space.
The other 3 rooms upstairs were just being renovated actually.
The staff were lovely, all of them, really going out of their way.
I think Nyoman was supposed to clean the pool,i would like to see this done  each morning, although we had no problems with it as such.... it is just nice to see it being cleaned and scrubbed each morning like the hotels down south and then you know.

We walked along the beach and chatted to all the locals that live on the beach, met a 90 year old, so tiny, so lovely.
Also met my massage lady, and she invited us in to see her little home.
We didn't want to leave this time.
Next time we will stay a week.
We were really at ease and chilled at Villa Agung and very much look forward to getting back there.
title: Serene

photos.caption: Villa Agungs bar on the beach

text:
The Good:  
+  The owners sent their driver to pick us up at the airport in Denpasar.  It cost 400.000 Rupiah.  He was a good, safe driver.
+   It is right on the beach.
+   The food was good (ate 2 meals there).
+   Nice views for sunsets!
+   Owners greeted us and were friendly.
+   Room came with mosquito nets and mosquito coils and bug spray--you will need them all.

The Not-So-Good:
+   The family room was set up very poorly.  Only one door to leave from, which meant going through that room whenever you need to leave.  The OTHER room had the bathroom, which meant going through that room for the toilet.  So it did not really give privacy.
+   The bed...we actually both rolled to the middle when we got on it!  Granted, I'm heavy, but this has only happened before on an air mattress!
+   The beach was DIRTY.  We had hoped to play on the sand with our daughter, but even taking a walk meant walking through trash, wrappers, broken glass, etc.  It's not a place to enjoy a beach (other than looking at the sunset from the restaurant).
+    The bricks/ground were very slick with mud and moss.  I was worried our daughter was going to slip and land on her head.  
+    The pool was very small and set into the ground, making it dangerous for young children.
+    We set up our trip beforehand and asked for the price per night.  Our room was quoted at 440.000 Rupiah (approx. $44 USD).  When we got there, we noticed the listed price for our room was only 350.000 Rupiah.  I find it quite rude when hotels quote a higher price than they truly charge. (We did have to pay the 440.000)
+    The room really was bare bones.  Nothing luxurious about it.  It doesn't make it much of a vacation when the rooms are in worse shape than your own home (holes in paint, loose hinges, NO HOT WATER, etc).
+    The "Open Air" bathroom meant a huge 4x6 foot hole in the wall at head-level.  
+    We weren't sure who to pay for the driver.  The driver wanted to be paid himself, and asked us several times for the money.  We didn't know if we were supposed to pay him or the hotel and didn't want to pay the wrong person, so we waited until Sandy came at dinner time.  It ended up that we were supposed to pay the driver, so we promptly did.  That created a bit of stress for us, as we didn't want to hand over so much money to the driver personally if we weren't supposed to.

+++++++++++++++++++++
I've tried to be really fair with this review.  I have no clue why it has so many stars on tripadvisor (which is the reason we chose it).  We took a bemo (local transport/mini bus) down the road the 2nd morning we were in Lovina and found a travel agent who helped us find a more suitable hotel.  He even drove us back to Villa Agung in his car and explained to the owners (his friends) that the accommodations weren't working out for us and asked them to help us get to another hotel (suitcases and a baby!).  

Well, they didn't.  We toted our suitcases and baby in a stroller out to the road and got another minibus.  We ended up walking almost a kilometer with all of our luggage before making it to our new hotel.  Granted, I do understand we should in no way expect a hotel to transport us to another hotel, but it would have left a better taste in our mouths if they had helped us out like the travel agent/their friend had asked them to.

I'd also like to add that we brought our nanny with us (a new experience living in Indonesia is having a nanny for less than $100/month--we're not rich, just teachers who need child care).  We had also chosen Villa Agung because they offered free accommodation for our nanny.  It ended up being their storage area.  I peeked inside and yes, it did have 2 twin beds and a mandi (type of Indonesian bath), but it also had all their storage items like a vacuum cleaner, boxes, bags full of stuff, etc.  I was not comfortable having our nanny in basically a large "storage closet" which was another reason we chose to leave.

We ended up staying at Suma, which had a beautiful pool our daughter couldn't fall into, pathways for her to walk around on, flowers for her to point at, and a cleaner/better room for us to enjoy--all for less money, too.  

Hopefully I have been honest and precise in my review.  I would never recommend this hotel, after seeing others in the area and knowing what they offer and at what prices.  While Gus and Sandy were great with communication via e-mail and are nice people, this type of accommodation does not equal vacation for us, and would imagine it wouldn't for the vast majority of travelers.    

(Pictures to come)
title: Nice owners, Older hotel, Not for families with children.

owner_response.text:
What can I say?  I think our reputation must stand with all of our really happy guests who have previously written their reviews.  To answer some of these criticisms.  March is rainy season and the rivers on either side of our beach swell and dump their trash on the beach. Our beach is cleaned every day.  As our guests will attest, we would never leave people to struggle with luggage and a baby as we do all we can to help our guests get around.  The money changer is a relative of Suma Hotel and brought the guests back to our hotel in his car, assuring us that he would arrange transport for them to his relative's hotel and no request was ever made for help.  
As for the FREE accommodation for their pembantu (nanny),  we are currently renovating the upstairs rooms and so we had to store items in the large cottage where we offered the nanny accommodation.  
Many families have stayed in our family rooms and have been quite content with the layout.  Just read the reviews!   Toddlers have stayed here with no complaints from parents, who just keep their eyes open.  This comes with toddler territory.  There are few hotels in Bali that have gated pools.  
As for overcharging,  we have just installed an extra air conditioner for the family rooms and the price has gone up Rp 50 000.   My staff had not yet changed the price on their board and  this is in an area off limits to guests anyway. 
It greatly saddens me to have such scathing remarks as my staff are wonderful and the hotel is spotlessly clean.  Be your own judge.  Thanks for your understanding.  Sandy Bauman
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We had a nice relaxing time at Villa Agung.  Gus and Sandy really made us feel welcome and their staff was very helpful.  If I ever go back to Bali, I will return to Villa Agung!
title: Cute place right on the beach with wonderful hospitality!

text:
Stayed at Villa Agung Beach Inn. Now that was a nice little place to be, right on the beach. 150,000Rp per night/standard/fan with hot & cold water, including brekky. Their Watermelon with Tamarillo Syrup(Terong Belanda) and grated Coconut was to "Live For"! Not really Watermelon eaters, but this was beautiful! Found some(Terong Belanda) at Hardy's Supermarket in Sanur, brought two bottles home, but not packed well enough and one broke in my bag! Sticky stuff everywhere, but all washed out ok and didn't stain clothes thank goodness! I think that Hardy's in Sanur are the only ones that stock it! Well according to Gus and Sandy, mine hosts at Villa Agung anyway. 
Gus and Sandy are great hosts - he is from Washington, DC in the states, and Sandy is from the Jersey Islands near Britain somewhere. 
Standard rooms were great in my book!  Everything very clean. Only used it for sleeping, and relaxing if I wanted some afternoon peace and relaxation. Room upstairs, so had a nice breeze at night. Left both doors open for more breeze. Mossie net to stop the little buggas! I think they were rather flabbergasted that the Country Bumpkin Aussie slept with doors and windows wide open, haha! Anyway,I found the Villa Agung a great little place to stay. The kitchen was immaculate and clean. Cooking classes available. The staff very well trained and couldn't help you enough. Laundry very cheap. Gus, the owner very helpful, and showed you around. He showed me a couple of very good Material shops(Chinese owners) in Singaraja. Very cheap and beautiful materials(depending on what you wanted), approx 25,000rp per metre. Their small Bintangs 12,000, didn't have any big ones so don't know price. Kitchen open all day, so you could eat or drink at anytime up till 8pm. Night Security on Sat night would feed you Bintangs into the early hours if required. Not really a Party place, but all your needs were looked after. No fridge in room, but who cares?
Only probs here were with the Beach Seller ladies and fellas. Weren't allowed on the property, but if you went for a massage on the beach(only did it twice, she was good that's for sure) with Made the Massage Lady, all the sellers would hone in on you at the end of the massage eh? And if owners were away down south, they seemed to be allowed in??
They were selling Pearls, Belts made out of Coconut wood?, Sarongs, Shirts, Women's Tops, Pants, wooden Dolphins, etc, etc. Lots of stuff anyway. Too expensive in my book. Found a nice little shop round the corner in the next street, where I could buy Sarongs for 20,000 each, but was told not to tell the Beach Ladies or they'd get into trouble. Sounds a bit Mafiarish to me? Anyway I didn't say a word! 
So, an allround good place to stay, I think! Good place to get to know the locals at the Warungs etc.  10/10 I would give Villa Agung.    Cheers Cheryl
title: Loved Villa Agung

text: I have to admit, I was initially disappointed when we arrived to the Villa Agung, but within a couple of hours I came to really like it.  It's not in Lovina, but down the road, and one of the first things I noticed is the pool was tiny.  A reviewer mentioned that the room was "shabby," and I agreed... but then it started to grow on me.  First, I realized that the room was more than adequate for what we needed, a beach-side, quiet, clean place.  The black sand beach was beautiful and the water was clear -there's someone who works there to help clean the beach every morning.  We started talking to another family who was also staying there and their company helped a lot to make me feel comfortable.  We also met the owners, and Gus made us feel right at home.  By the time we tried the food for dinner I was already enjoying it, but the food was... wow!  There was an extensive menu, and Sandy had taught the staff how to cook Western dishes as well as the Indonesian ones they offered.  In the end, we relaxed and did puzzles in the "hang out" room upstairs from the dining area and really enjoyed our time at the Villa Agung.  We were also happy to book our "dolphin viewing" trip through the Villa Agung, although there were no dolphins to be found!  One recommendation: pay as you go for meals and drinks and such.
title: Warmed up to the Villa Agung

photos.caption: Relaxing area with view of Beach

text:
Our family- 2 adults, 2 teenagers - stayed at the Villa Agung for 4 days in October 2006. We wished we could have stayed another 4 days as it was a wonderful relaxing location, fantastic sunsets, terrific, reasonably priced food and drinks and friendly, helpful service. The owners are fantastically helpful and great company. We stayed in the family suite, two adjoining rooms, with air con, fridge and very clean. The food is really top class and we ate every meal there, a first for us as we generally "spread the love around" when we travel and like trying new places. we were interested to note that guests from a nearby 5 star hotel regularly walked down the beach to use the restaurant which is open to the public. Although the location is a bit out of the way that didn't bother us. Sandy (owner) took us with her to Singaraja and into Lovina or arranged for her driver to do so at no cost whenever needed. The bemos are also frequent during the day. Sandy was also incredibly helpful when we needed medical attention for an injury our daughter had sustained earlier in our trip. 
If you wanted to go and party in Lovina every night the location would probably be a bit of a drawback but for us it was perfect. My husband and son had a fun night down the beach in the rasta bar and there are other places around. The views over the ocean from the restaurant and the lounge above it are stunning, the pool is small but clean and the grounds are also lovely. The girls who do the waiting and housekeeping are all locals and very friendly and efficient. Nyoman the groundskeeper/driver, another local, is a real character. 
All in all, a lovely small, homely boutique hotel which we will definitely visit again and would highly recommend to anyone other than those looking for 5 star luxury or "party animals".
title: Relaxing hotel, great food

text: Vulla Agung is a boutique property right on the beach at Anturan, Lovina. There are 6 bedrooms and 2 cottages, restaurant  with an excellent menu and a small pool in a pretty courtyard garden. it's a very peaceful location away from the main village. We stayed there for 6 nights in Sept 2006. Gus and Sandy, the owners, live next door and could not have done more to make us feel welcome. they really put themselves out for their guests. The staff are also extremely pleasant and helpful. it is not expensive and has all the facilities, fridge, air-con etc. The only difficulty is that there is no transport to the nearest village in the evening but we still recommend it very highly.
title: Home from home

text: L’hôtel a été refait récemment. La piscine est vraiment agréable. La chambre était très grande avec une grande salle de bain/ wc.La climatisation n'était pas trop bruyante. Le personnel était extrêmement gentils et attentif avec une mention particulière pour Nyoman. Les petits déjeuners sont copieux et excellents. L’hôtel est calme la nuit. La plage, noire comme tout le nord de Bali est nettoyée tous les jours. Le soir, le spectacle est sur la terrasse: le couché de soleil sur l'est de Bali est fabuleux.
title: hotel agréable, restaurant très bon et super couché de soleil!

text: Prima toeven voor een paar dagen. Leuke restaurants in de buurt (vraag na bij de medewerkers/kijk op de kaart), Vanuit hier prima dagtochtjes naar de verschillende bezienswaardigheden. Vriendelijke eigenaars (Amerikaans), echter wel op leeftijd
title: Villa Agung Beach Inn, Lovia Beach

owner_response.text: Thanks for the nice comments.  You are only as old as you behave!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Das Hotel liegt an einem schönen Strand in einer ruhigen Bucht, wo man trotzdem mehrere Warungs finden kann. Unweit von dem Hotel liegt ein Fischerdorf, das man unbedingt besuchen sollte.
Unser Zimmer war gross und wurde jeden Tag sauber gehalten. Der Wasserdruck war nicht immer ausreichend und die Stange von dem Duschvorhang war nicht richtig befestigt und einmal runtergefallen. Ich finde, man sollte solche Mängel schnell beseitigen.
Das Frühstück war leider für uns mager.
Die Mitarbeiter waren sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Hotel verfügt über ein Restaurant, in dem man lecker essen kann.
title: Okay

owner_response.text:
Thank you for pointing out the shower problem and we will replace all with glass doors immediately.  Sorry for that inconvenience to you.
Water pressure in August is a central government issue and we all suffer from this because there is such a great demand.
Size of breakfast is a personal value issue depending on your appetite.  We have fruit, juices, eggs, pancakes, toast and homemade breads and jams.
Otherwise we appreciate your stay and welcome your comments.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Wij hebben eind juli enorm genoten van het hotel dat rustig en aan zee ligt. Goede kamers en schoon. De vriendelijke en geïnteresseerde Amerikaanse eigenaren hebben een geweldige stek met fantastisch en lief personeel. Het ontbijt en het diner waren heerlijk. De dolfijnen hebben we gezien zonder dat ze werden opgejaagd.
De eigenaar wil je eventueel naar het stadje brengen. De was kun je voor een schappelijke prijs laten doen.
title: Aanrader. Genoten, prachtige stek.

owner_response.text:
thank you ,so much . you were great guests , who enjoyed your time in bali .
thank you , again .
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Naast de kamer die netjes en fijn was, was het zwembad heerlijk. Het uitzicht is fantastisch. De eigenaren en medewerkers zijn uiterst vriendelijk. Simpel maar prima ontbijt. Een tripje dolfijnen geboekt en echt constant dolfijnen op korte afstand gezien. Het was fantastisch!
title: Fantastisch!

owner_response.text:
So glad you were happy here and liked our breakfast.  We make all our own breads on site.
We had to figure out a way to give guests the dolphin tour without the "chasing of the dolphins", which so many guests hated.  I think we finally got it!
Sandy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Ons verblijf in Villa Agung was geweldig. De kamers waren schoon en netjes. De Amerikaanse eigenaren ontzettend vriendelijk. We hadden wat problemen met onze creditcard en ze deden er alles aan om ons te helpen. Het ontbijt was lekker, keus genoeg. Daarnaast heeft het een prachtig zwembad aan het strand. Wij zouden hier zo terug komen!
title: Fantastisch verblijf

owner_response.text:
Sorry about the credit card machine.  It has been a problem for a few days.  
So glad you loved Villa Agung.  We work hard to keep it clean and fresh.  Much nagging from the boss!  Sandy is actually English and proud of it!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Super hotel! Vriendelijke Amerikaanse eigenaren, fijn zwembad en direct aan de zee. Fijn als je op zoek bent naar rust, aangezien het wel een klein stukje van het centrum ligt. Het is echter makkelijk om met de taxi naar het centrum te komen. Ze bieden leuke tours aan rondom Lovina.
title: Heerlijk hotel

owner_response.text: It was great having you here and I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We now have pick up service from our recommended restaurants and can give you a ride to some others that at present don't have pickup.  Sandy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Lækker mad, perfekt beliggenhed, personalet var vildt søde, hjælpsomme og imødekommende, værelserne lyse og rene og god størrelse, poolen var ren og indbydende, og stemningen var afslappende og skøn. Vores allerbedste anbefalinger.
title: Fantastisk, fantastisk, fantastisk

owner_response.text: We loved having you and thanks for all the good words.  Your kids were a delight!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
3.gang vi bodde på Villa Agung.Var der i 11 dager.stortrivdes.Koselige eiere Sandy and Gus som hele tiden passet på at vi hadde det bra.Fine store rom og 2 helt nye rom som ikke var helt færdig i mai. Rommene ligger rundt et basseng som var helt ny iår. Nydelig hjemmelaget mat og spesielt  brød og marmelade.
Fantastisk solnedgang der du koset deg med en drink mens sola gikk i havet.
Trivelige jenter som jobbet der.Vi vil helt klart bo der neste gang vi drar til Bali. I love that place.
title: Nydelig plass helt på beachen

owner_response.text: I cant speak Norwegian but I know this group of people well.  They have stayed many times with us and are a delight to have and FUN!  Thank you so much for a lovely review which sort of translates to English, but I got the picture.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Отель не новый, небольшой. Номерам уже требуется обновление. Мы приехали только на ночь, поэтому не особенно обращали внимание. Приятный персонал, внимательный менеджер. Хорошее меню в ресторане и вид на море. Бассейн гораздо меньше, чем на фото
title: Небольшой мотельчик. Вполне уютно, но требует реновации

text:
Wir hatten eine wunderschöne Zeit in der Villa AGUNG. Gus (Owner), Mr. NOMAN (Mann für Alles) und das gesamte Personal vermittelten nicht das übliche Gefühl in einem Hotel zu wohnen, sondern eher wie bei einer Gastfamilie zu Besuch zu sein. Alle waren sehr herzlich und erfüllten jedweden Wunsch. Das Hotel liegt direkt am schwarzen Sandstrand, welcher täglich einen wunderschönen Sonnenuntergang bietet.
Das Essen war super und wurde täglich frisch zubereitet. Sehr zu empfehlen ist das selbstgemachte Brot, dass es zu jedem Frühstück gibt. 
Wir würden immer wieder kommen.
title: Nicht einfach nur ein Hotel!

text: Когда мы приехали, нас встретил сам хозяин, каждому пожал руку и показал его номер. Мы были большой компанией и занимали 4 номера. В каждом номере была одна большая кровать для родителей и одна двухъярусная для детей. Небольшой бассейн. Самое главное из ресторана сразу выход на море. Песок черный вулканический, его то мы и приехали посмотреть.
title: Отель на берегу моря

text: Небольшой уютный отельчик, расплоложенный прямо на берегу моря. Завтрак включен в стоимость, разнообразный и очень вкусный! Свежий хлеб с домашним джемом был просто пальчики оближешь! Ну и порадовало соотношение цена-качество. Все что нужно для отдыха за разумные деньги! Рекомендую!
title: Отличный отель на берегу моря!

text:
Situato a 200 mt. dalla spiaggia di Anturan e lontano dalla Lovina Beach, ma i taxi costano veramente poco. 
Zona molto silenziosa, bel giardino, piscina con vasca idromassaggio. 
Le camere sono molto grandi con TV, aria condizionata, lasciano un po’ desiderare i bagni. 
Buona anche la colazione, specialmente la mattina del buffet.
title: Viaggio con bambini

text: Die Villa Agung ist nicht gerade eine First Class-Unterkunft, aber es ist sauber und sehr individuell und persönlich geführt. Wir haben das Frühstück direkt am Strand und die Ruhe genossen! Die Lage in Lovina ist etwas außerhalb aber einfach mit dem lokalen Bus erreichbar oder Gus fährt einen kurz rum. Bei Interesse an der indonesischen Kultur und Lebensweise, wird man auch schon mal mit zu den Häusern des Personals mitgenommen. So bekommt man einen tollen Einblick in die lokalen Verhältnisse. Wir haben hier in aller Abgeschiedenheit die letzte unserer drei Wochen Bali genossen und selbst den Kindern tat die Ruhe absolut gut.
title: Super persönlich mit besonderem Flair

text: Jammergenoeg ben ik hier maar 1 nacht geweest .volgende keer blijf ik beslist langer. Wat hier zo mooi is is de rust en het haasten van denpasar is hier helemaal weg. Jammer genoeg totaal geen dolfijnen gezien maar dat hoor je wel vaker
title: Heerlijk

text: Wir hatten das Hotel für eine Nacht auf unserer Bali Rundreise. Bei dem Hotel handelt es sich um ein kleines Hotel was von einem Pärchen und einigen Angestellten geführt wird. Insgesamt gibt es glaube ich nicht mehr als 10 Zimmer. Bei der Ankunft wird man persönlich durch die Besitzer begrüßt und es herrscht eine sehr familiäre Stimmung. Man bekommt Ausflugstipps und alles was man noch so brauch. Die Zimmer sind etwas in die Jahre gekommen aber für eine Nacht völlig ausreichend. Auf dem Zimmer findet man gratis Wasser, Autan gegen Mücken und alles andere was man für den Aufenthalt dort brauch. Die Preise der Minibar sind sehr günstig was auch für das hauseigene Restaurant direkt am Strand!!! gilt. Wie bereits erwähnt, liegt das Hotel zwar etwas abseits von Lovina, ist aber direkt am Strand und man hat eine echt tolle Aussicht. Das a la Carte Frühstück war sehr gut. Insgesamt ein guter Aufenthalt.
title: Kleines Hotel mit guter Strandlage und freundliche Besitzer

text:
Wij (mijn vriendin en ik) hebben hier een verblijf geboekt via booking.com. Maar door een fout van booking.com was er geen plaats meer. Dus kregen we al een beetje stress. Maar totaal overbodig, de hotel eigenaren ( een zeer vriendelijk amerikaans koppel) hadden al een kamer geregeld vlakbij. Dit was een prachtige hotelkamer en we moesten zelf minder betalen. toch zijn we dagelijks terug naar Villa Agung Beach Inn gegaan om te ontbijten en dineren. Het eten is hier super goed, beter ga je echt niet vinden! De sfeer is zeer huiselijk en aangenaam. Het is ver genoeg van het centrum om uit de drukte te zijn ( geen lastige verkopers...) maar er ook dicht genoeg bij om een bezoekje te brengen. Iedereen helpt je er heel graag verder met eender wat zonder dat er iets wordt op gedrongen.

Echt een absolute aanrader!!!
title: Time to relax

text: ตอนที่ตัดสินใจไป lovina ตัวเลือกที่พักมีไม่มากนัก ตัวที่พักสะอาดสงบติดชายหาดสีดำ บริการเรียบร้อยดี ห้องน้ำอาจจะดูเก่าไปสักนิดแต่ส่วนของที่นอนนุ่มสบาย ระเบียงห้องสามารถไปคุยกับเพื่อนอีกห้องได้ เป็นระเบียงห้องยาวติดกัน
title: บรรยากาศดี

text: Ubicado directamente en la playa, tiene los atardeceres más espectaculares de Bali. Las habitaciones son amplias, la cama muy cómoda... no es un hotel lujoso, pero es un rincón perfecto ubicado en un lugar espectacular. Los dueños del hotel son entrañables y muy simpáticos y te hacen sentir como en casa. La piscina es chiquitina, pero suficiente. 100% recomendable
title: Entrañable hotel

text:
Wenn sie ein familiäres, ruhiges, schuckeliges Hotel, das direkt am Strand liegt suchen, dann sind sie richtig hier. Wir verbrachten 6 Nächte in diesem Hotel. Sie frühstücken, faulenzen nur max 10 m vom Meeresrand enfernt. Wenn sie noch ungestörter sein wollen genießen sie die laue Brise auf der ersten Etage.
Sie profitieren von den Erfahrungen der Besitzer Sandy und Gus und könnn sich bei der Buchung von Ausflügen auf Nyoman verlassen. 
Wenn sie ins 2,5 km entfernte Lovina wollen können sie Gus bitten oder in einen öffentlichen Minibus steigen.
title: Familiäres Wohlfühlhotel

text: Etwas abseits des geschehens von lovina, man kann sich aber sehr gut beschäftigen, zumal das personal zuvorkommendst alle pläne zu erfüllen sucht und einen die besitzer gerne mitnehmen in das dörfliche leben. Das restaurant ist direkt am meer und das essen ist lecker. Auf jeden fall empfehlenswert!
title: Hübsches, ruhiges hotel

text:
Nous avions choisi cet hôtel en raison des critiques sur Trip Advisor qui étaient relativement bonnes.

Toutefois, ce fût un cauchemar:
- L'hôtel est placé près de nul part.
- La plage est atroce. Couverte de déchets et occupée par des chiens errants et ses vendeurs agressifs.
- Le resort sort tout droit des années 70 sans jamais n'avoir été rénové.
- La piscine est minuscule, sale et non éclairée.
- La nourriture est excécrable et il n'y a pas beaucoup de choix aux alentours.
- La chambre était dégoutante, la salle de bain donnait la nausée (insectes et malpropreté).
- L'Internet fonctionne 1 fois sur 4 ce qui nous a causé beaucoup de problèmes lorsque nous avons voulu fuir cet endroit.
- ...

Le proprio et le gérant (?) se sont montrés aidant lorsque j'était désespéré pour l'Internet (urgence de quitter cet endroit). Sans résultat par contre... L'Internet tombait toujours en panne.

Nous avions réservé trois nuits et avons quitté après la première sans pouvoir obtenir de remboursement pour les deux autres.

Je préférais perdre de l'argent que de rester dans ce trou étrange et inquiétant.

Ne vous laissez pas charmer par le prix de l'endroit vous regretterez d'y être allé.

Je ne comprends absolument pas que certains puissent donner une note positive à cet endroit. Il y a beaucoup mieux à Bali pour ce prix et de toute façon.. Lovina est à éviter. Villa Agung Beach Inn l'est tout autant.
title: Cauchemar

text:
Hotel face à la mer.
Vue splendide du resto et de l'espace détente qui est en hauteur.
Bons plats et excellents petits déj.
Plage moyenne.
Chambres vieillissantes qui mériteraient un rafraîchissement.
Accueil chaleureux des propriétaires.
Préférable de choisir un hotel dans le centre car celui ci est excentré .
Bémo  pour y aller 5000 r par pers.
Tarif pour 2 ad et 3 enf a 50 euros.
title: Accueil chaleureux mais établissement défraîchi

text:
2月份带家人一起来巴厘，罗威那的两晚我们选择了阿贡海滩别墅。这里是一处宁静的海边小院，院子里装点着精致的园林，不大，但很安静。一个大露台面对着大海，用餐和发呆时都可以吹着海风，看到海景，非常放松。
员工白天和晚上都有人值班，管家Noman非常热心，会主动了解客人的需求并乐于提供帮助。老板GUS也很热情。
我们订的是家庭间，性价比非常好，不过卫生间的清洁可以再做得好一些，下水有点不是太顺。
地点离罗威那中心偏远了点，周围没吃喝的地方，可以在酒店里点，价钱还算公道。另外，也可以花点钱请NOMAN开车接送一下，几分钟时间就可以去到中心地带海豚广场那，吃饭，取钱，做SPA都很方便。不建议走路去，那条路汽车很多。
title: 宁静海滩边的温馨小院

text:
Placeringen af dette hotel er super god, og restauranten ligger perfekt ud til vandet.
Desværre var standarden af vores værelse ikke i orden. Vasken var stoppet og der kom kun få stråler ud af brusehovedet. Køleskabet var heller ikke i top, og der var flere sodavand og chokolade som var for gammelt. 
Hotellet arrangerede en rigtig fin tur, så vi kunne se delfinerne i båd om ved solopgang. Hotellet hjalp os ligeledes med at finde en chauffør, som kunne køre os til seværdighederne i området. Vi var først lidt skeptiske overfor denne chauffør, da det var en af de mænd som gik rundt på stranden og ville sælge noget, men det skulle vise sig, at han blev den bedste chauffør vi havde kørt med. 
Så alt i alt en lidt blandet oplevelse.
title: God beliggenhed, værelserne gennemsnit

text: Villa agung was één van mijn hoogtepunten van mijn reis. We werden opgehaald vanaf het vliegveld naar het hotel / paradijs. Heerlijke plek om tot rust te komen. Super mooi aangelegd, ingericht. Sfeer, heerlijk eten (!!), open bibliotheek aan zee op een XXL balkon, zwembad, super vriendelijk personeel en de Amerikaanse eigenaar is ook zeer aardig. De chauffeur van het hotel brengt je naar de mooiste plekken in het noorden van Bali. Ik kom hier zeker terug.
title: Magische plek

text: Nous avons logé durant une semaine dans un hotel à proximité mais tout les soirs, notre plaisir était de venir dans la salle ouverte sur la plage pour profiter du coucher de soleil et surtout des plats locaux délicieux de la carte. L'accueil était remarquable tant du chef de salle (un balinais fort attachant) que du propriétaire (expatrié anglais). Attention le restaurant ferme à 20 heures 30. Mais il ne faut rien manquer des spécialités locales très bien cuisinées!
title: Restaurant fantastique

text:
hicimos una reserva a través de booking.com y en teoría había que pagar en el establecimiento y se podía cancelar la reserva - según condiciones de booking. 
Sin embargo, el hotel nos contactó un mes antes de nuestra llegada y nos pidió que pagáramos por paypal, dado que nos teníamos que alojar en época de mucha afluencia (8 sept)... algo que resultó no ser cierto porque solo una habitación más estaba ocupada!

Así lo hicimos - sin comprobar que el importe que nos pedían en euros coincidía con el precio oficial de 475.000 rupias.

Qué sorpresa pues posteriormente nos dimos cuenta de dos cosas:

- Si hubiésemos pagado al contado cuando tocaba nos habríamos ahorrado unos 7 euros (por fluctuación en el tipo de cambio)... con lo que pagamos a deshora innecesariamente y más caro.

- Además de eso, el importe que nos solicitó a pagar por paypal era 5 euros más caro que el precio de la habitación!!! Lo he comprobado con el histórico de tipos de cambios oficiales de euro-rupias y me sale que nos han timado!!!

O sea, que acabamos pagando 12 euros de más!!!!

Buscad otro sitio para alojaros!!!
title: Cuidado al pagar! No os fiéis!

text: decisamente scarso unica nota positiva la location fronte spiaggia per il resto camere datate senza manutenzione ,proprietario un americano ormai anziano che ha la propria abitazione vicino al l'hotel decisamente lasciato al l'abbandono mi domando con che giudizio gli assegnino un punteggio così alto, probabilmente molti viaggiatori Australiani o americani preferiscono un "good morning" nella loro lingua che una camera pulita e decente sconsigliato
title: scarso ........

text:
Hôtel situé à environ 8 km de Lovina. L'accueil et le personnel est très agréable mais le complexe hôtelier est vieillissant. La piscine est très petite mais entretenue. La chambre familiale est propre mais la décoration est d'un autre temps, le couchage des enfants étaient 2 lits superposés dans un espace restreint. La salle de bain à ciel ouvert aurait pu être agréable mais la découverte de vers sortant des galets disposés sur le sol nous a obligé de nous doucher avec nos tongs.
La plage est nettoyée par le personnel de la propriété mais reste impropre à la baignade. C'est partout pareil à Lovina.
Les petit-déjeuners et repas sont savoureux et le personnel très attentionné. Très beaux couchers de soleil!
title: Hôtel vieillissant

text:
Genoten van ons verblijf in Villa Agung. De kamers zijn erg fijn, met allemaal nieuwe matrassen en nieuwe douche. Alles werkt perfect. Het restaurant is tevens erg goed, met veel keuze en mooi opgemaakte gerechten. Aanrader dus!

Het hotel op een aantal km van het centrum van Lovina ligt. Dat wordt gecompenseerd met door het hotel aangeboden vervoer.
title: Fijn, schoon en vriendelijk hotel

text:
